0.title: This rate hike was needed: Uday Kotak on repo rate hiked to 4.40%
0.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak has said the Reserve Bank of India's decision to hike the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40% is justified. "I think this rate hike was needed and I'm glad that they have acted intra-market and intra policy," Kotak stated. He added that the bank will be transmitting the rate hike to its borrowers.

1.title: CSK's Mukesh Choudhary hits Virat Kohli in direct hit attempt, apologises immediately
1.article_body: CSK pacer Mukesh Choudhary hit Virat Kohli with the ball while attempting a direct hit during RCB's first over in their IPL 2022 match on Wednesday. Kohli played the delivery straight to Mukesh, who attempted a direct hit seeing Kohli out of crease. The ball hit Kohli as he dived to get inside the crease, following which Mukesh apologised immediately.

2.title: Agnihotri says scheduled press conference for Kashmir Files was cancelled, shares chat
2.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri claimed that Press Club of India (PCI) cancelled a scheduled press conference on 'The Kashmir Files'. "The watchdogs of democracy...not only banned me undemocratically but are also lying through their teeth," Agnihotri tweeted, sharing messages of an agency directed to book PCI. He further said the press conference will now be held at a Delhi 5-star hotel.

3.title: Farmer finds 11.88-carat diamond worth around ₹50 lakh in MP mine
3.article_body: A small-time farmer in Madhya Pradesh's Panna district has found an 11.88-carat diamond in a mine. As per private estimates, the diamond may fetch over ₹50 lakh at an auction. The money received from the auction will be used for setting up a business and for the education of the farmer's children.

4.title: Royal Bengal Tiger attacks animal keeper at Chennai's Vandalur Zoo
4.article_body: An animal keeper at Chennai's Vandalur Zoo sustained minor injuries after he was attacked by a Royal Bengal Tiger. The animal keeper, identified as Chellaiya, has been with the wildlife sanctuary for more than three decades now, officials said. "The tiger was not keeping well...The caretaker...was present alongside the veterinary team so nothing major happened," the zoo director said.

5.title: Investors lose ₹6.27 lakh crore as Sensex crashes 1,300 points after repo rate hike
5.article_body: Investors lost ₹6.27 lakh crore on Wednesday after the Sensex ended 1,306 points lower, at 55,669, after the RBI announced a 40 bps hike in repo rate to 4.40%. The broader NSE Nifty tanked 392 points to finish at 16,678. Bajaj Finance was the biggest loser in the Sensex pack, followed by Bajaj Finserv, Titan, IndusInd Bank and HDFC Bank.

6.title: Which cricketers have played the most matches for a single franchise in IPL?
6.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni on Wednesday became the second player after RCB's Virat Kohli to play 200 matches for a single franchise in IPL. Kohli is playing his 218th IPL match for RCB today, the most IPL matches by a player for a single franchise. Kohli and Dhoni are followed by Kieron Pollard (187, MI) and Rohit Sharma (177, MI).

7.title: Rohit, Tiger to invest 4-5 months to prepare for 'Rambo': Report
7.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Dhawan and actor Tiger Shroff will reportedly be investing four to five months to prepare for their upcoming film 'Rambo'. "Rohit will start working on it after he wraps up...'Shehzada' with Kartik Aaryan and Kriti Sanon," a source told Pinkvilla. "While Tiger will train for the larger-than-life action sequences, Rohit will begin the pre-production formalities," the source added.

8.title: Chennai man beaten to death by de-addiction centre workers, 7 held
8.article_body: Chennai Police said that a 48-year-old man was beaten to death by workers at a de-addiction centre and seven people were arrested in the case. The police found out that the deceased, M Raj, who was addicted to alcohol, had created a ruckus at the de-addiction centre and was beaten up by facility workers with sticks and other items.

9.title: Mother of two raped by a 20-year-old in Andhra's Vizianagaram
9.article_body: A 26-year-old woman, a mother of two children, was raped by a 20-year-old man at her residence in Andhra Pradesh's Vizianagaram. Police said that the victim had separated from her husband and was staying in a rented house in Vizianagaram with her children. Deepika Patil, Vizianagaram Superintendent of Police, said that the accused was taken into custody.

10.title: Pics show gifts PM Modi gave to leaders of 5 nations he met in Denmark
10.article_body: After meeting leaders of Nordic countries, PM Narendra Modi gifted Rogan Painting from Gujarat to Denmark Queen Margrethe II. He gifted a Pashmina stole in Papier Mache box from J&K to Sweden PM Magdalena Andersson and a Brass Tree of Life from Rajasthan to Finland PM Sanna Marin. He gifted Dokra boat from Chhattisgarh to Crown Prince Frederik of Denmark.

11.title: AAP's Raghav Chadha, Atishi booked for 'defamatory remarks' against BJP
11.article_body: The Delhi Police have named AAP MP Raghav Chadha and MLA Atishi in a non-cognizable report for their alleged defamatory remarks against BJP and its workers. "Atishi and...Raghav Chadha referred to BJP workers as criminals, hooligans, rapists during press conferences on April 15 and 16," the report, which was registered based on BJP IT cell chief Abhishek Dubey's complaint, noted.

12.title: DRG jawan martyred in encounter with Naxals in Chhattisgarh
12.article_body: Police said that a District Reserve Guard (DRG) head constable was killed in an encounter with Naxals in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur district. The encounter took place around 8.15 am on Wednesday at a forest in Tulargufa-Mungari area, IGP Sundarraj P said. A joint team of various security forces was out on a search operation when the encounter took place, he added.

13.title: Culprits involved in riots will not be spared: Rajasthan CM
13.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said the culprits involved in riots will not be spared and added that the government was taking steps to ensure no violence takes place in Rajasthan. "No one has the right to take law and order in their hands," he added. His comment comes after communal clashes in Jodhpur on Tuesday.

14.title: NHRC issues notice to UP Chief Secy, DGP over gang-rape of 13-yr-old
14.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission on Wednesday issued notices to the Chief Secretary and Director General of UP Police and sought a report within four weeks over the alleged gang-rape of a 13-year-old. Stating that it had taken suo motu cognisance of media reports of the case, the Commission said the content amounted to human rights violation of the victim.

15.title: EU promises more military aid for Moldova amid Ukraine crisis
15.article_body: European Union (EU) pledged more military assistance for Ukraine's neighbouring country Moldova on Wednesday amid the former's invasion. European Council President Charles Michel said that EU will step up aid for Moldova in the "field of logistics [and] cyber defence". The move comes amid reports of unrest in Moldova's breakaway region of Transnistria, which is controlled by pro-Russian forces.

16.title: Filmmaker Rohit Dhawan, wife Jaanvi blessed with a baby boy
16.article_body: Rohit Dhawan and his wife Jaanvi Dhawan welcomed a baby boy. This is their second child together after the birth of their daughter Niyara in 2018. A media account shared a video of Rohit and his father David Dhawan stepping out of PD Hinduja Hospital in Mumbai. Rohit made his directorial debut with Akshay Kumar and John Abraham-starrer 'Desi Boyz'.

17.title: Pfizer opens Asia's 1st global drug development centre in Chennai
17.article_body: US pharmaceutical company Pfizer on Wednesday launched a global drug research and development centre at the IIT Madras Research Park in Chennai at an initial investment of ₹150 crore. The 61,000-square-foot facility is among 12 centres established worldwide and the first in Asia. It employs 250 scientists and technicians, and would develop and support products in global markets, Pfizer said.

18.title: India's services exports set new record of $254.4 billion in FY22
18.article_body: Commerce Ministry on Wednesday said India's services exports set a new record of $254.4 billion (over ₹19 lakh crore) in FY22. It added that services exports also hit an all-time monthly high of $26.9 billion in March 2022. The top contributors to the exports were transport, telecommunications and computer and information services, the Ministry added.

19.title: Man crashes ₹5 crore Ford GT supercar just days after buying it in US
19.article_body: A 50-year-old man crashed his Ford GT car into a tree just days after buying it for $704,000 (over ₹5 crore) at a US auction. Police report said that the crash was caused by inexperience with a manual transmission. The driver claimed that old tires, muddy pavement and fresh detailing caused the car to swing out and hit a tree.

20.title: PM Modi's pic in Germany from 1993 surfaces amid his Europe tour
20.article_body: An old picture of PM Narendra Modi in Germany has surfaced on social media amid his Europe tour. It shows a young PM Modi, when he was a BJP worker, and one of his colleagues standing before statue of Charlemagne. It was reportedly taken in 1993 in Frankfurt, where he had a brief halt while returning to India from US.

21.title: I focus on my work: Kartik Aaryan on Dharma Productions controversy
21.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has opened up about his controversy with Karan Johar's Dharma Productions after the actor was no longer a part of 'Dostana 2'. "I just focus on my work. That's all I would like to say about this," Kartik stated. "What happens...is people make a mountain out of a molehill. There's nothing more to it," he added.

22.title: Congress cell's lawyers yell at Chidambaram, show him black robes at Calcutta HC
22.article_body: Senior Congress leader and advocate P Chidambaram faced protest by lawyers of Congress' legal cell at Calcutta High Court. The video of the incident shows the lawyers showing him black robes and shouting slogans, saying he's a TMC sympathiser and responsible for Congress' poor show in West Bengal. Chidambaram was reportedly representing a company sued by Congress' Adhir Chowdhury.

23.title: Putin miscalculated his brutal invasion of Ukraine: Chancellor Scholz
23.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Wednesday said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "completely miscalculated with his brutal invasion of Ukraine". Scholz said that Putin is now facing "a stronger NATO" and "a unified European Union". His remarks came after a two-day closed-door German Cabinet meeting on the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war and its impact on the German economy ended today.

24.title: Baseball signed by Ukrainian Prez Zelenskyy to be sold for war relief aid
24.article_body: A baseball signed by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is being auctioned in US to raise funds for Ukraine amid its ongoing invasion. The leading bid for the baseball as of Tuesday had exceeded $15,000 (over ₹11 lakh), the auctioneer confirmed. Zelenskyy had signed the ball in 2019 for an American collector, Randy Kaplan, who collects baseballs signed by world leaders.

25.title: Mumbai man's edited obscene pic leaked after he fails to repay loan
25.article_body: Mumbai police have registered an FIR against unknown persons for circulating a morphed obscene photo of a 23-year-old man after he failed to repay loans worth ₹6,000. The complainant said that he took the loans from two mobile applications. He added that six members of his family and locality had received the photo, which came from five different numbers.

26.title: CSK to bowl first against RCB, Dhoni featuring in his 200th IPL match for CSK
26.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni won the toss and elected to bowl first against RCB in their IPL 2022 match on Wednesday. Dhoni is playing his 200th IPL match for CSK. CSK have made one change to their playing XI, with Moeen Ali replacing Mitchell Santner. Meanwhile, RCB are fielding an unchanged side.

27.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan calls for early polls under ‘neutral’ authority
27.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Tuesday called for expedited general elections, adding that it should be held under supervision of a "neutral" chief election commissioner. Khan, who was ousted from power via a no-trust vote in parliament last month, stated that new government has been imposed on people. PML-N leader Shehbaz Sharif took oath as Pakistan PM on April 11.

28.title: Policeman who raped 13-yr-old rape survivor in UP police station arrested
28.article_body: The Station House Officer (SHO), who allegedly raped a 13-year-old rape survivor when she had gone to the police station to file a complaint in Uttar Pradesh's Lalitpur, has been arrested from Prayagraj. The police officer was absconding. Earlier, the SHO was suspended and all policemen of the police station in Lalitpur were sent to police lines.

29.title: Ukraine war set to worsen severe hunger worldwide: UN report
29.article_body: UN's Global Network Against Food Crises said that Russia's invasion of Ukraine poses serious risks to global food security. In a report, it said the number of people facing acute food insecurity and requiring urgent life-saving food assistance has nearly doubled since 2016. "If more isn't done to support rural communities...scale of...devastation in terms of hunger...will be appalling," it added.

30.title: 78% of Indian organisations hit by ransomware in 2021: Survey
30.article_body: As many as 78% of Indian organisations were hit with ransomware in 2021, up from 68% in 2020, a survey by security vendor Sophos claimed. It said the average ransom paid by Indian organisations that had their data encrypted in most significant ransomware attacks was $1.2 million. Some 10% of victims payed ransoms of $1 million or more, it added.

31.title: Adani's Mumbai International Airport raises $750 mn from Apollo
31.article_body: Adani Enterprises said its subsidiary Mumbai International Airport Ltd (MIAL), which runs the Mumbai airport, has raised $750 million senior secured private placement notes from Apollo-managed credit funds. The proceeds will be used to refinance existing shorter maturity loans and new capital expenditure, it added. In March, Adani Enterprises concluded financing of its Navi Mumbai airport.

32.title: Ahan Shetty reacts to Athiya Shetty & KL Rahul's wedding reports
32.article_body: Reacting to reports of his sister Athiya Shetty and cricketer KL Rahul's wedding, Ahan Shetty said, "There's no such ceremony, these are all rumours." He added, "When there's no wedding, how can we give you a date?" Ahan said that the duo have not even been engaged and stated, "There's no planning for a wedding in the next few months."

33.title: Negative comments do affect me, I'm not an android: Elon Musk
33.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk, while speaking on Met Gala's red carpet, said that he's not immune to the negative comments made about him. "Well, it does get to me sometimes, I mean...I do have feelings. I'm not an android," he stated. He, however, added that he tries to "take these things with a grain of salt".

34.title: Loudspeakers removed peacefully from mosques in UP: Dy CM Maurya
34.article_body: UP Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya said on Wednesday that the peaceful manner in which loudspeakers are being removed from religious places in state "is an example for the entire country". "Opposition always makes provocative remarks but...law and order in UP is [fine]," he added. Nearly 54,000 loudspeakers were removed from religious places in UP till May 1.

35.title: 91% of 11 lakh people in Delhi believe BJP orchestrates riots: AAP
35.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party claimed that 91% of the 11.5 lakh respondents to its survey in Delhi believe that BJP orchestrates riots. Responding to the second question, which was about the party having the highest number of goons, 89% of people said it's BJP, 5% believed it's Congress and 2% said it's AAP, according to Deputy CM of Delhi Manish Sisodia.

36.title: Civic authorities asked to raze down illegal structures in Thane
36.article_body: Senior civic officials of the Kalyan Dombivli Municipal Corporation (KDMC) in Maharashtra's Thane have been asked to take action against illegal structures and encroachments, officials said. KDMC commissioner Dr Vijay Suryavanshi said land sharks encroached on civic utility lands and carried out construction work, the official added. He directed officials to identify such properties and raze them.

37.title: I like being different: World's tallest living woman who holds 4 world records
37.article_body: Turkey's Rumeysa Gelgi, the tallest living woman at 7-feet-0.7-inch height with four Guinness World Records, said, "I like being different from everyone else." She also holds records for the longest finger on a living person (female), the largest hands on a living person (female) and the longest back on a living person (female). Her height is due to Weaver syndrome.

38.title: NATO barking at Russia's door may have facilitated Ukraine's invasion: Pope Francis
38.article_body: Pope Francis said that NATO "barking" at Russia's door may have led to Russian President Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine. "I wouldn't know if this provoked an ire but perhaps it facilitated it," he stated. Asked about a trip to the Ukrainian capital Kyiv, the Pope said, "First, I've to go to Moscow, first I have to meet Putin."

39.title: AAP workers protest against corruption in KPSC in B'luru, detained
39.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) workers protested against Karnataka Public Service Commission (KPSC) in Bengaluru over alleged corruption after which the workers were detained by the police. The protest was led by AAP's Bengaluru President Mohan Dasari. "People who appear for KPSC are not seeing any hopes. Every year one or the other scam emerges in KPSC," he said.

40.title: Booking MP Navneet, MLA Ravi Rana for sedition was stupidity: Fadnavis
40.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday said Mumbai Police's decision to book Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her MLA-husband Ravi Rana for sedition was stupidity. "There can not be anything more stupid than arresting someone for reciting the Hanuman Chalisa. This was foolishness of the government and the grant of bail establishes that," Fadnavis said.

41.title: People in Hyd take out boats as rain brings relief & waterlogging
41.article_body: People in Hyderabad used rubber boats after heavy rains lashed parts of the city on Wednesday morning causing waterlogging in many areas. A PTI report said waterlogging and inundation were seen in several localities of Hyderabad, including Amberpet, Kukatpally, Malkajgiri and Musheerabad and the old city. Thundershowers are likely to occur in parts of Telangana, IMD said.

42.title: Tamil Nadu administration bans Mutt's palanquin ritual; devotees protest
42.article_body: Tamil Nadu administration denied permission for 'Pattina Pravesam' ritual in Mayiladuthurai in which devotees carry the Dharmapuram mutt's seer on a silver palanquin. A group of devotees held a protest against the government's decision ahead of the ritual scheduled for May 22. State BJP chief K Annamalai said he would lift the palanquin himself if authorities didn't allow the ritual.

43.title: PM Modi meets leaders of 5 countries in Denmark, pic released
43.article_body: PM Narendra Modi met leaders of Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden on Wednesday for the second India-Nordic Summit in Copenhagen. Releasing the picture of the leaders, External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson said, "The 2018 Summit in Stockholm was the 1st time India engaged with the Nordic countries as a group on a single platform."

44.title: PM adopted policy of 'All rank, No pension'; insult to nation: Rahul
44.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday accused PM Narendra Modi of adopting the 'All Rank, No Pension' policy after the scam of the 'One Rank, One Pension' policy. He also accused PM of insulting the nation by not giving pensions to hundreds of servicemen, including three-star officers. The government should give pensions to former servicemen at the earliest, he said.

45.title: Pune Police look for man who sought ₹7cr for ‘bomb threat’ information
45.article_body: Pune Police have launched search to track a man who made hoax call on Tuesday regarding 'bomb threat' at a railway station. The accused, who dialed emergency helpline number 112, sought ₹7 crore from authorities to reveal the location. "As we launched a probe into...call, we also mobilised...Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad and other quick response teams," an official said.

46.title: Biggest kept secret: Benedict on if Cruise appears in Doctor Strange 2
46.article_body: Actor Benedict Cumberbatch has reacted to the rumours of actor Tom Cruise being part of his film 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. "Tom? Yeah, he's in every scene you haven't seen in the trailer. It's the biggest kept secret," Benedict said. Speaking about fan theories, he said, "I try not to react or go to the internet."

47.title: Vibrant independent press a cornerstone for healthy democracy: Blinken
47.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Tuesday said that a vibrant independent press is a cornerstone for any healthy democracy. He further said that exercise of freedom of the press is facing profound threats in the current time. "Governments are supplementing traditional forms of repression with new tactics aimed at undermining press freedom," he added.

48.title: 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' faces legal action over sex-determination scene
48.article_body: Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' is facing legal action in Delhi High Court over the prenatal sex determination scene in the trailer. According to Live Law, advocate Pawan Prakash Pathak's plea stated that the practice of prenatal sex determination as shown in the trailer is prohibited. In the plea, Pawan asked for the scene to be deleted for promoting prohibited activities.

49.title: PM Modi meets Finland PM, discusses ways to deepen bilateral ties
49.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday met Finland PM Sanna Marin during his Europe tour and discussed ways to further deepen bilateral ties. "There is immense potential in expanding the India-Finland digital partnership, trade partnership and investment linkages," PM Modi said. He also held a series of bilateral meetings with his counterparts from Norway, Sweden and Iceland.

50.title: Sundar Pichai fact-checks his Wikipedia page edits, says 'I wasn't homeschooled'
50.article_body: Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai during a recent interview fact-checked edits made by people on the Wikipedia page about him. On an edit claiming he was homeschooled, Pichai clarified, "I wasn't homeschooled." On edits naming several Indian schools that Pichai studied at, he clarified, "Two schools are right...the final school is 'Vana Vani', situated in the IIT Madras campus."

51.title: LIC IPO subscribed 63% on Day 1; staff, policyholder portions fully subscribed
51.article_body: India's biggest-ever IPO of LIC was subscribed 63% till 5:06 pm on the first day of bidding on Wednesday. The LIC policyholders led the initial bout of buying in LIC's IPO as they subscribed 1.84 times the portion reserved for them. The employee reserved portion has subscribed 104% while the retail investors' portion has been subscribed 56%, Moneycontrol reported.

52.title: Pic shows strong solar flare erupting from Sun, NASA highlights its impact on Earth
52.article_body: The Sun emitted a strong solar flare on April 30, an image of which has been shared by NASA. It can be seen in the bright flash in the picture's upper right portion. Solar flares are sudden releases of magnetic energy, which if directed towards Earth, can impact radio communications, electric power grids and pose risks to spacecraft and astronauts.

53.title: Rahul never spoke for T'gana, his visit to state is political: TRS MLC
53.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha on Wednesday termed Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's upcoming visit to Telangana 'politically motivated', adding that he'd never spoken for the state's welfare. "During...paddy crop issue, we urged him (Rahul Gandhi) to raise the issue in Parliament..but he did not," she said. Her remarks come days after Gandhi was denied permission to visit Hyderabad's Osmania University.

54.title: EU proposes Russian oil ban to make Putin 'pay high price' for Ukraine
54.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen has proposed a ban on all oil imports from Russia by year-end to make President Vladimir Putin pay a "high price for his brutal aggression" in Ukraine. The ban would be part of EU's sixth package of sanctions against Russia. The proposal requires approval from all 27 member countries to come into effect.

55.title: RCB's NRR is so bad that only points can take them through: Shaun Pollock
55.article_body: Ex-MI all-rounder Shaun Pollock said RCB's net run-rate (NRR) in IPL 2022 so far is "so bad" that only points can take them through. "You don't see them squeaking through after being level on points. It is all about winning," added Pollock. Talking about CSK who will face RCB today, Pollock stated that CSK cannot afford to make a mistake.

56.title: B'luru Traffic Police creates green corridor for live heart transportation
56.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police on Wednesday created a green corridor for transporting a live heart to a hospital in the city and also shared a video of the same on Twitter. The corridor to carry the live heart was created between Manipal Hospital in Hebbal to MS Ramaiah Memorial Hospital. Police also provided a green corridor for transportation of liver today.

57.title: Extreme Muslim appeasement: BJP to KCR on allowing to write Group I exams in Urdu
57.article_body: The BJP criticised the Telangana government over its decision of giving option to write exams for Group I posts in Urdu language and said that CM K Chandrashekar Rao was indulging in politics of appeasement for his vote bank. "This is extreme Muslim appeasement...The exam written in Urdu can only be corrected by a Muslim," BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri said.

58.title: Man takes off 2 girls' clothes, urinates in Delhi school; principal tells girls 'forget it'
58.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal has issued a notice to police after a man allegedly entered a municipal school in Delhi and sexually assaulted two girls. She said the man took off the girls' clothes and urinated in front of an entire class. "When the girls told the principal & teacher, they said 'forget about it'," Maliwal added.

59.title: My 1st shot ever was an action sequence: Akshay on 30 yrs in B'wood
59.article_body: After completing 30 years in Indian cinema, actor Akshay Kumar recalled the first-ever shot of his filming career. In a video clip released by YRF's Twitter handle, Akshay can be heard saying, "Pehla shot action ka diya tha Ooty mein (My first shot ever was an action sequence in Ooty)." The actor made his Bollywood debut with 'Saugandh' in 1991.

60.title: Announce dates of BMC elections within 2 weeks: SC tells Maha govt
60.article_body: The Supreme Court has ordered the Uddhav Thackeray-led Maharashtra government to declare schedule for the pending BMC elections within two weeks. The apex court also said that the matter of OBC reservation in the election will be heard later. Earlier, the state government had said that BMC elections will be held only after OBC reservation in the elections was approved.

61.title: Hyd police advises people to drive safe amid rainfall, waterlogging
61.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police alerted people to drive safe amid rainfall in the city on Wednesday. The traffic police also shared a video of a waterlogged road in the city and wrote, "It's raining. Please drive carefully." Waterlogging was seen in several localities, including Amberpet, Kukatpally, Malkajgiri, Musheerabad and the old city.

62.title: No masks or COVID-19 tests needed to attend Cannes: General secretary
62.article_body: Cannes general secretary Francois Desrousseaux has said that guests attending the 2022 event will not have to show proof of testing or vaccination. "Most participants will likely be vaccinated anyway because France has made it very complicated for non-vaccinated travellers to enter the country," Francois added. He said masks will no longer be mandatory indoors, however, are strongly recommended.

63.title: Russia warns it'll target transport carrying NATO weapons in Ukraine
63.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu on Wednesday accused the US and its NATO allies of "continuing to pump weapons into Ukraine".  "We view any transport of...NATO arriving on the territory of the country with weapons or materials destined to the Ukrainian army as a target to be destroyed," Shoigu warned on day 70 of Russia's 'special military operation' in Ukraine.

64.title: EU chief proposes phased ban on all Russian oil imports
64.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday proposed a phased oil embargo on Russia, sanctions on its top bank and a ban on Russian broadcasters from European airwaves. "Today, we will propose to ban all Russian oil from Europe. This will be a complete import ban on all Russian oil-seaborne and pipeline, crude and refined," Leyen said.

65.title: Time will reply: Sidhu after disciplinary action sought against him
65.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Wednesday shared a tweet, days after Punjab Congress in-charge Harish Chaudhary sought disciplinary action against him. "I often listen in silence to conversations against me...I have given...right to reply to time," Sidhu tweeted in Hindi. Chaudhary wrote a letter to Sonia Gandhi seeking action against Sidhu for trying to "portray himself above the party".

66.title: Vendor refuses to give free bhelpuri to drunk man in Gurugram, killed
66.article_body: A drunk man allegedly killed a 40-year-old street vendor in Gurugram after he refused to serve him bhelpuri for free, police said on Tuesday. The incident took place on Monday when Ram was on his way home with his wife, who alleged that a half-naked man hurled a stone at her husband, which hit the back of his head.

67.title: 3 Char Dham pilgrims die of heart attacks on way to Yamunotri
67.article_body: Three elderly pilgrims, including a woman, died of heart attacks on way to Yamunotri on Tuesday, the opening day of the Char Dham Yatra. The district's Disaster Management Officer, Devendra Patwal, said that all the deaths occurred at different spots along the trek route from Jankichatti to the Himalayan temple. All the three deceased persons were aged above 60 years.

68.title: RBI Governor warns of inflation, higher edible oil prices
68.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has warned that edible oil prices may go further up despite the central bank hiking the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40%. He said it was due to export restrictions by key producing countries and the loss of sunflower oil output amid Russia-Ukraine war. "Looking ahead, food inflation pressures are likely to continue," he stated.

69.title: Mumbai Police shares Blake Lively's Met Gala pics in password awareness post
69.article_body: Mumbai Police took to Instagram to share pictures of actress Blake Lively to make a reference about her dress transformation at Met Gala 2022. "Keep your passwords 'Lively'. Change them frequently," Mumbai Police wrote. Lively had worn a red-toned gown with a large bow. The actress' bow was later untied and unveiled the blue part of the gown.

70.title: I try to find out where they've come from: MI's Zaheer on working with youngsters
70.article_body: Opening up on his role as MI's Director of Cricket Operations, ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan said he helps players with the technical and mental aspects of the game. "It's important to get to know each other. So, I always try and find out where they have come from...anyone should be comfortable coming up and having conversations," he stated.

71.title: Rahul seen with those who challenge India's territorial integrity: BJP
71.article_body: A day after a video of Rahul Gandhi partying at a nightclub in Nepal surfaced online, BJP leader Amit Malviya asked why he's only seen with those who challenge India's territorial integrity. "Rahul Gandhi was supposedly at the wedding of Sumnima Udas, a Nepali diplomat's daughter, who actively supports Nepal's claims over regions of India's Uttarakhand," Malviya tweeted.

72.title: Zomato shares hit record low of ₹64, fall over 7% on Wednesday
72.article_body: Shares of food delivery giant Zomato hit a new record low of ₹64 as they fell 7.13% to close at ₹64.5 on Wednesday. Zomato has wiped out over half of its investors' wealth since January 3, when its stock price hit a high of ₹142.45. Zomato had launched its IPO in July 2021 with a price band of ₹72-76.

73.title: Need your wishes: Bhuvan Bam on making OTT debut with Taaza Khabar
73.article_body: YouTuber Bhuvan Bam announced his OTT debut on Wednesday. Sharing two pictures on Instagram, Bhuvan revealed the title of the project, 'Taaza Khabar'. Alongside the post, he wrote, "Need your wishes for my OTT debut. Your constant support has been a boon for me. New stuff this year." In the first picture, Bhuvan is seen holding Taaza Khabar's script.

74.title: He would've got 80-90 in 50 balls at his peak: Ojha on Kohli's 58 (53) vs GT
74.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's 53-ball 58 in RCB's defeat against GT by six wickets, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said, "Had he played 50 balls at his peak, he would have been on 80-90." "[I] want Kohli to play a bit more aggressively," added Ojha. Kohli has scored 186 runs in IPL 2022 so far at a strike rate of 116.25.

75.title: Britons buying less meat and fish, struggling to pay bills: Report
75.article_body: The Britons are buying less meat, fish and poultry owing to the rise in cost of living, market research firm NielsenIQ has said. The volume sales of those items decreased by 13% year-on-year in the four weeks leading to April 23. According to official data revealed last week, nearly one-fourth of the citizens were struggling to pay their household bills.

76.title: Beijing partly shuts down public transport to control COVID-19 spread
76.article_body: Beijing on Wednesday closed 40 subway stations and around 150 bus routes to restrict movement in a bid to curb the spread of COVID-19. The move comes days after the city barred dine-in services at restaurants and suspended in-person classes in schools till May 11. Additionally, city residents are required to undergo three COVID-19 tests throughout the week.

77.title: Couple killed, several injured as truck hits bus carrying pilgrims in UP
77.article_body: An elderly couple died while several others were injured after a bus carrying pilgrims was hit by a container truck in UP's Etawah on Wednesday. According to the Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP), 50 passengers were on the bus when it met with an accident on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway. Ten injured people were admitted to hospital, the officer added.

78.title: Delhi govt announces free bus travel for construction workers
78.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party-led Delhi government announced that they will make travel free for construction labourers working in the national capital. "All construction labourers earlier had to spend somewhere between ₹1000 to ₹3000 per month for travelling," Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. "This (step) will benefit about 10 lakh labourers in the state," he added.

79.title: Comedian Dave Chappelle attacked on stage, Chris Rock jokes 'Was that Will Smith?'
79.article_body: Comedian Dave Chappelle was attacked on stage while performing at an event in Los Angeles, according to reports at the scene. As per ABC journalist Stephanie Wash's tweet, Chris Rock, who performed earlier, came on stage and joked, "Was that Will Smith?" Chris was slapped by Smith on stage at Oscars this year.

80.title: How will the RBI's repo rate hike affect loan EMIs and FD rates?
80.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday announced that the repo rate has been increased by 40 bps to 4.40% with immediate effect. This can lead to banks hiking EMI rates of home, auto or personal loans. The repo rate hike can however mean better returns for FD (Fixed Deposit) investors on new FDs.

81.title: Have emergency backup plan in case of power outage: Delhi Metro
81.article_body: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) Managing Director Vikas Kumar on Tuesday said that DMRC is not facing any power crisis currently and has backup plans for any emergency. "DMRC receives 99 MW of electricity...through its off-site solar plant and generates 50 MW from the rooftop solar plants," Kumar said. "We are only 50% dependent on discoms," he added.

82.title: BMRCL spares over 100 trees and 152-yr-old church with revised station plan
82.article_body: The Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has decided to spare over 100 trees and the 152-year-old All Saints' Church on Hosur Road as it revised the underground metro station plan. The decision to revise the plan comes after the church group, along with some NGOs and groups, complained to European Investment Bank (EIB), which was funding the metro construction.

83.title: 2 surprises cancelling each other out: Du Plessis on CSK captaincy change
83.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja handing back CSK captaincy to MS Dhoni, RCB captain Faf du Plessis said, "I'm surprised [it] happened mid-IPL 2022." He added, "But I was also surprised at the way it happened...before the season. So, it's like two surprises cancelling each other out." Du Plessis further said, "Obviously...there's no secret...when MS is there, he is the captain."

84.title: 'I have had my share of disappointments': RBI Governor quotes Mahatma Gandhi
84.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das, who on Wednesday announced the repo rate is being hiked by 40 bps to 4.40%, quoted Mahatma Gandhi during his address. "As Mahatma Gandhi said: "I have had my share of disappointments, uttermost darkness, but I am able to say that my faith has ultimately conquered every one of these difficulties"," Das said during his address.

85.title: B'wood can be unforgiving if you aren't from film background: Pooja
85.article_body: Speaking about her sporadic Hindi film career, actress Pooja Hegde said that it was a conscious decision to not do many Hindi films. "I've been offered films opposite big stars but those characters didn't add any value to the script," she added. "[Bollywood] can be...unforgiving if you aren't from...film background...it takes...time to get the...roles...you want to do," she said.

86.title: Tanzanian national held in Hyderabad with heroin worth ₹11.53 crore
86.article_body: The Air Intelligence Unit (AIU) on Tuesday arrested a Tanzanian national from Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport and seized 1389.1 gram of heroin worth ₹11.53 crore. According to officials, 108 capsules containing heroin, wrapped in an adhesive transparent tape were recovered from him. "During...investigation, it was revealed that he swallowed the capsules in Tanzania," officials said.

87.title: Need to protect women's right to choose: Biden on abortion draft
87.article_body: Amid reports of a leaked Supreme Court draft that would challenge a landmark abortion rights ruling, US President Joe Biden said it would threaten basic rights like access to birth control and marriage. He said if the ruling is overturned, elected officials will have to "protect a woman's right to choose". Voters will have to elect pro-choice officials, he added.

88.title: Russia bans Japanese PM, other top officials from entering the country
88.article_body: Russia on Wednesday banned 63 Japanese citizens from entering the country "indefinitely" for engaging in "unacceptable rhetoric" against Moscow. Those barred from entering Russia include Japanese PM Fumio Kishida, Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi, Defence Minister Nobuo Kishi and other officials, professors, and journalists. Japan has imposed sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine.

89.title: Which are the five biggest sixes of IPL 2022 so far?
89.article_body: PBKS' Liam Livingstone smashed the biggest six of IPL 2022, covering a distance of 117 metres against GT's Mohammad Shami. The second-biggest six was hit by MI's Dewald Brevis (112 metres) against PBKS' Rahul Chahar. Livingstone has also hit the third-biggest (108 metres) and the fifth-biggest six (106 metres). The fourth-biggest six (107 metres) was hit by RR's Jos Buttler.

90.title: Mandira turns off comments post getting trolled for sharing pool pics with friend
90.article_body: Actress Mandira Bedi recently took to Instagram to share a few pool pictures with her friend on his birthday. Sharing the photos, she wrote "Happy Birthday...This photograph says it all. What you mean to me...and how much I trust you." As soon as she shared the pictures, several users trolled her. Later, Mandira turned off the comments on her post.

91.title: CSK know how to make a comeback: Sunil Gavaskar
91.article_body: Ahead of CSK's game against RCB on Wednesday, former India captain Sunil Gavaskar said CSK know how to make a comeback. Gavaskar added that things turn around in a jiffy in IPL and no team can afford to take the others lightly. Currently, CSK are ninth on the IPL points table with only three wins from nine games so far.

92.title: Playing Hanuman Chalisa not a one-day affair, it will continue: Raj Thackeray
92.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray said that playing Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques is not a one-day affair, it will go on until the government addresses the situation according to what the Supreme Court has said about loudspeakers. Out of 1,140 mosques in Mumbai, 135 mosques violated the guidelines, Thackeray said. What action will be taken against these mosques, he asked police.

93.title: Hit emotional breakdown; thought marriage will fix problems : Justin Bieber
93.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber said that when he first got married, he got a bit of an emotional breakdown. "I thought marriage was going to fix all my problems and it didn't. It just kind of was a reflection of like, man, you're a bit of a hypocrite man," he said, adding that religion has played important part in his life.

94.title: Hyderabad Police chief celebrates Eid with children, pics surface
94.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand celebrated Eid with children at Eidgah near Miralam while reviewing security arrangements on Tuesday. Pictures shared by the city police show the officer interacting with people on the occasion. The city Police Commissioner also distributed sweets among those present there.

95.title: Murray defeats Shapovalov to set clash against Djokovic in Madrid Open
95.article_body: Ex-world number one Andy Murray defeated Denis Shapovalov 6-1, 3-6, 6-2 to reach the third round at the Madrid Open 2022. Murray will now face Novak Djokovic in their first match since the Qatar Open final in 2017. "I haven't had that opportunity to play against Djokovic for a long time...so I'll enjoy it...give it my best," said Murray.

96.title: 54-yr-old man, his 2 grandchildren die as jeep overturns in Rajasthan
96.article_body: A 54-year-old man and his 2 grandchildren were killed as the jeep they were travelling in overturned in Rajasthan's Bikaner on Wednesday, police said. "Members of a family, including several children...were going to Bikaner city to purchase clothes for two weddings scheduled in the family on Thursday and Friday," police added. Around 13 more people were injured, police further said.

97.title: Punjab government transfers 43 IAS, 38 PCS officers
97.article_body: CM Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government on Wednesday transferred 43 IAS and 38 PCS officers and also gave additional charges to some officers. Senior IAS officer Sarvjit Singh, who is the Additional Chief Secretary (Agriculture), has been given additional charge of soil and water conservation. Meanwhile, IAS officer Bhupinder Singh has been appointed as Special Secretary, Health and Family Welfare.

98.title: 2 Hindu sisters donate 20,400 sq ft land for Eidgah in Uttarakhand
98.article_body: Two elderly sisters named Saroj Rastogi and Anita Rastogi have donated around 20,400 sq ft of land for an Eidgah in Uttarakhand. The land has been donated to fulfil the wish of their late father. "It's a great act in such an atmosphere when our country is reeling under communal frenzy," the head of the Kashipur area's Eidgah committee said.

99.title: First time a song had such a big launch: Kartik on 'Bhool...2' title track
99.article_body: Discussing the title track of his upcoming film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', actor Kartik Aaryan said, "It is for the first time that a song had such a massive launch where we covered four cities in a day." "The kind of response we...got, it has truly surpassed all our expectations," added Kartik. "I am elated seeing the reaction," stated Kartik.

100.title: Religious festivals have become weapon for communal politics: Brinda Karat
100.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Brinda Karat said it is a matter of concern that religious festivals have become a weapon for communal politics in the country. Her remarks came following the communal clashes that took in place Rajasthan's Jodhpur. "The forces which are trying to spread unrest are succeeding in their agenda," she added.

101.title: Rain & hailstorm lash parts of Delhi amid heatwave; video surfaces
101.article_body: A hailstorm accompanied by rainfall was witnessed in parts of Delhi on Wednesday amid heatwave in parts of the country. A video has surfaced on social media showing hailstorm in the city. The IMD had issued a yellow alert and warned of a dust storm, thunderstorm or hailstorm with winds gusting up to 50 kilometres per hour in the city.

102.title: IIT Madras makes computer science courses available to the public
102.article_body: IIT Madras has made its Computer Science courses like Programming and Data Structures, Advanced Data Structures and Algorithms and Foundations of Computer System Design among others available to the general public. These courses have YouTube recordings of live lectures from the university and can be accessed by educational institutions, students or anybody else on their official website.

103.title: Journalist Boria Majumdar banned by BCCI for 2 years for bullying, threatening Saha
103.article_body: Journalist Boria Majumdar has been banned by the BCCI for two years after being found guilty of bullying, threatening and intimidating wicketkeeper-batsman Wriddhiman Saha over an interview request. Boria won't get accreditation as a member of press for any cricket matches in India for two years and he won't be allowed to interview any registered cricketer during the time period.

104.title: H'yana BJP plans outreach programme to celebrate 8 yrs of Modi govt
104.article_body: BJP's Haryana unit will launch an outreach programme on Thursday to mark the completion of eight years of PM Narendra Modi's government. BJP spokesperson Sudesh Kataria said that party leaders will take the welfare policies of the Modi government and the state government to the public during the programme. The programme intends to cover 21 lakh families in 21 days.

105.title: OnePlus 10R 5G with HyperBoost Gaming Engine available on open sale now
105.article_body: OnePlus announced that the open sale for its flagship OnePlus 10R 5G smartphone has begun today. The smartphone aims to deliver an improved gaming experience and features like 6.7" 120Hz FHD+ Fluid AMOLED display, MediaTek Dimensity 8100-MAX chipset & HyperBoost Gaming Engine. It offers two SUPERVOOC charging options, 150W and 80W, in Sierra Black & Forest Green editions.

106.title: Disgusting: Lili calls out Kim over losing weight to fit into her Met Gala dress
106.article_body: Actress Lili Reinhart seemingly called out Kim Kardashian after she admitted she went on an extreme diet in order to fit into Marilyn Monroe's dress for her Met Gala 2022 look. Taking to social media, Lili wrote, "To walk on...red carpet...where you say how starving you are...because you haven't eaten carbs...to fit in a f***ing dress...The ignorance is other-worldly disgusting."

107.title: Underground Chhatarpur metro station to link Yellow, Silver lines: Official
107.article_body: Chhatarpur station on Delhi Metro's Yellow Line will soon get an underground interchange station to connect it with the upcoming Silver Line (Tughlakabad to Aerocity), said DMRC Principal Executive Director (Corporate Communications) Anuj Dayal. The interchange facility will be provided via the existing station's gate number two. Construction of the Silver Line corridor has commenced, DMRC said.

108.title: Clashes in Rajasthan result of appeased culture of Cong govt: Vasundhara Raje
108.article_body: Former Rajasthan Chief Minister and Bharatiya Janata Party leader Vasundhara Raje on Tuesday slammed the Congress-led state government for the communal unrest in the state. "After Karauli and Alwar, the incident of communal tension has now come to the fore in Chief Minister's home town, Jodhpur. Such incidents are result of the appeased culture of Congress-led Rajasthan government," she said.

109.title: Bombay HC grants anticipatory bail to BJP MLA Ganesh Naik in rape case
109.article_body: Bombay High Court on Wednesday granted anticipatory bail to BJP Airoli MLA Ganesh Naik in a rape case. Naik was booked by the Navi Mumbai Police for allegedly threatening and raping a female friend. The woman had claimed that she had been in a live-in relationship with Naik for over 27 years and he is her son's biological father.

110.title: Sensex crashes over 1,300 points to end at 55,669 after repo rate hiked to 4.40%
110.article_body: The stock benchmarks fell the most in over eight weeks on Wednesday after the RBI announced a 40 bps hike in repo rate to 4.40%. While the Sensex tanked 1,306 points to close at 55,669, the Nifty 50 tanked 392 points to close at 16,678. Reliance Industries, HDFC Bank, HDFC and Bajaj Finance were among the top index losers.

111.title: Judge denies Heard's request to dismiss Depp's defamation lawsuit
111.article_body: Amber Heard's request to dismiss actor Johnny Depp's defamation lawsuit mid-trial has been denied by Judge Penney Azcarate.  "The court should grant the motion to strike because the undisputed evidence is...Depp did...abuse Amber," said Heard's attorney. However, the judge denied the request and said enough evidence had been presented in the ongoing trial, adding the jury will give the verdict.

112.title: I've to keep forgetting he's my brother: Selvaraghavan on working with Dhanush
112.article_body: Speaking about actor Dhanush, the actor's brother and director Selvaraghavan said, "To handle such an actor, I have to keep forgetting he is my brother. I have to keep [reminding] myself...that he has achieved a lot." "During one or two films...I had a lot of things to tell him, then he was all on his own," added Selvaraghavan.

113.title: TMC appoints ex-Lok Sabha MP Kirti Azad as its new Goa unit chief
113.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Wednesday appointed cricketer-turned-politician Kirti Azad as its new party incharge in Goa. Azad, who previously served as a Lok Sabha MP from Bihar, had switched over to TMC from Congress in 2021. Notably, his appointment comes days after Kiran Kandolkar tendered his resignation as TMC's Goa unit chief, stating that party has 'no future in state'.

114.title: Suffered loss of ₹90,000: Delhi juice shop owner as his shop demolished
114.article_body: A juice shop owner in Delhi's Tughlaqabad, where the civic body demolished illegal construction, said his family has suffered a loss of ₹90,000. "My father and I have been running the shop for more than 23 years. I was crying and showed them the registration papers. They didn't stop," Mohammed Ashraf said. He further said, "Everything is gone now."

115.title: To see Gangubai Kathiawadi trend globally is overwhelming: Alia Bhatt
115.article_body: Speaking about the success of her film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', actress Alia Bhatt said, "With all the love that 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' has been receiving from its viewers all over the world, I'm rendered speechless." Alia added that she's overwhelmed to see 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' trend globally. "Our rich variety of Indian films continues to captivate people around the world," she said.

116.title: I've had worst experience with Swiggy, RIP customer care: Cricketer Gowtham
116.article_body: Cricketer Krishnappa Gowtham, who made his ODI debut in 2021 against Sri Lanka, took to Twitter on Tuesday night to complain about Swiggy. "I've had the absolute worst experience with Swiggy", Gowtham tweeted, adding that he didn't receive order placed at 9:45 pm. "At 11:35 pm...I got a response from customer support saying...there's nothing they can do #RIPCUSTOMERCARE," Gowtham said.

117.title: Akhil Gogoi demands govt to implement Article 370-like provision in Assam
117.article_body: Activist and Sivasagar MLA Akhil Gogoi on Wednesday demanded that the Centre should implement Article 370-like provision in Assam for the "Constitutional safeguard" of the indigenous people of the state. "The indigenous people of the state will not be safe until Article 370 or 371 (A) like safeguards are implemented," Gogoi said.

118.title: 76% prisoners are undertrials; ratio highest in Delhi, J&K: NCRB data
118.article_body: About 76% of all prison inmates in India were undertrials, of which about 68% were either illiterate or school dropouts, as per  National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) data for 2020. Among the undertrials, about 20% were Muslims, while about 73% were Dalits, tribals or OBCs. Delhi and J&K have highest ratio of undertrials in jails at 91%, the data showed.

119.title: Can't believe I'm such a lucky girl: Esha on completing 10 yrs in B'wood
119.article_body: Actress Esha Gupta completed ten years in Bollywood. Speaking about it, she said, "It's surreal and still feels unreal. Sometimes, I still cannot believe...I'm such a lucky girl to be an actor in the Indian film industry." "A girl from nowhere, making it to the big screen and people knowing my name! I cannot be more grateful," she added.

120.title: BJP high command instructed party to defame our govt: Rajasthan CM
120.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said that BJP high command instructed the party to "defame" the state government and create instability. "They (BJP) bulldoze the poor people's houses," Gehlot added. "Those who've become CM candidate...There is a competition (among them) and they have been given homework, which is why they are stretching everything," Gehlot stated.

121.title: India asking Russia to discount its oil to less than $70 per barrel: Report
121.article_body: India is trying to convince Russia for deeper discounts on its oil to less than $70/barrel in order to compensate for the risk of dealing with the OPEC producer, Bloomberg reported. Global benchmark Brent is currently trading near $105/barrel. India's private and state refiners have reportedly bought over 40 million barrels of Russian crude since its invasion of Ukraine.

122.title: We've just missed out when we are chasing big totals: David Warner
122.article_body: Talking about their performance in the ongoing IPL season, DC opener David Warner said they have managed to get "close" to winning most of their games but have missed out while "chasing big totals". He added, "There's strong competition...We could get that upper hand if we beat SRH." DC, who are seventh on IPL standings, will face SRH on Thursday.

123.title: Twitter tests 'Circle' feature to share tweets with up to 150 people
123.article_body: Twitter has started testing a new feature called 'Twitter Circle' that will let users send Tweets to select people, the company announced on Tuesday.  A user can include up to 150 people in their Twitter Circle and only those individuals can interact with the Tweets shared in that Circle. Currently, the feature's available to a limited number of people globally.

124.title: Pune civic body to clean manholes with robotic machines to avoid deaths
124.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to start cleaning manholes with the help of robotic machines to avoid deaths during the cleaning. Pune Smart City Development Corporation Limited bought three robotic manhole cleaning machines and handed them over to Pune civic body. The PMC already has jetting and other machines to clean manholes but these machines require more space.

125.title: India committed to meeting needs of poor, vulnerable through infra: PM
125.article_body: India remains committed to meeting the needs of the poorest and the most vulnerable by building the next generation infrastructure to realise their aspirations, PM Narendra Modi said on Wednesday. He was addressing the inaugural session of the International Conference on Disaster Resilient Infrastructure (ICDRI). "People must be at the heart of any infrastructure growth story," PM added.

126.title: Situation under control in Jodhpur: Police Commissioner Navajyoti Gogoi
126.article_body: Jodhpur Police Commissioner Navajyoti Gogoi, on Wednesday, said the situation in the city, where communal clashes broke out recently, is under control. "Right now, the situation is under control as no such incident (violence) has erupted in the city since yesterday noon," he said. Adequate police forces have been deployed and senior officials are monitoring the situation firsthand, he added.

127.title: Pune's SPPU rejuvenates British-era pond for rainwater accumulation
127.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has rejuvenated a British-era pond on its premises in a joint effort with Karve Institute of Social Service for rainwater accumulation purposes. The previously defunct pond, named 'Hatti Haud', has been rebuilt and will be operational from June onwards. "The rainwater [stored]...will reduce SPPU’s dependency on municipal water supply," an official said.

128.title: RBI hikes cash reserve ratio by 50 bps to 4.5% from May 21 onwards
128.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday said the monetary policy committee has decided to hike the cash reserve ratio (CRR) by 50 bps to 4.5% from May 21. Withdrawal of liquidity due to the hike could be to the order of ₹87,000 crore. Average surplus liquidity in the banking system was at over ₹7 lakh crore in April, Das said.

129.title: SC denies bail to Dawood Ibrahim's nephew in 2019 extortion case
129.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday denied bail to fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim's nephew in a 2019 extortion case for alleged threats issued to a builder. "We see no reason to allow the applicant on bail at this stage...investigation is complete and the charge-sheet is filed. We direct the court to frame the charges against the accused within six months," SC said.

130.title: Nepal airport terminal evacuated over 'suspicious object' phone call
130.article_body: Passengers and staff members were on Wednesday evacuated from the domestic terminal of  Tribhuvan International Airport in Nepal after authorities received a phone call claiming that a suspicious object had been planted inside the terminal. A search is underway for the suspicious object. Authorities are also working to determine the source of the phone call.

131.title: MNS General Secy performs 'Maha Aarti' in Pune's Hanuman temple, detained
131.article_body: The Pune Police on Wednesday detained MNS General Secretary Ajay Shinde and six others after they performed 'Maha Aarti' in Khalkar Hanuman Temple. "They were detained as per preventive action," Pune Police officials said. Over 250 Maharashtra Navnirman Sena workers have been detained for playing Hanuman Chalisa on loudspeakers, Maharashtra Police said.

132.title: Naxalite, wanted in over 40 cases, killed during gunfight in Jharkhand
132.article_body: A Naxalite, wanted in over 40 cases, was killed during a gunfight with security forces in Jharkhand's Khunti district. The deceased, Laka Pahan, was the sub-zonal commander of People's Liberation Front of India (PLFI). On Wednesday morning, a group of Naxals led by Pahan opened fire on security personnel, who retaliated in self-defence, thus killing Pahan, an official said.

133.title: Destroyed phone, tore my clothes: Kerala man who renounced Islam
133.article_body: A 24-year-old Kerala man, who had renounced Islam, was allegedly attacked by a group of people before addressing an event in Kollam. He was set to speak about his experience as a student of Islamic studies. "I was manhandled. They destroyed my mobile phone and tore my clothes…When locals raised an alarm, the police saved me," he said.

134.title: Amazon doubles export target from India to $20 billion by 2025
134.article_body: Amazon on Wednesday promised to export locally produced Indian goods worth $20 billion by 2025, doubling its $10 billion-goal set in 2020 for the same time frame. The company's 'Global Selling' programme has attracted over 1,00,000 exporters since its launch in 2015 in India, it added. In 2021, over 1,000 Indian exporters on the programme crossed ₹1 crore in sales.

135.title: Metro work on B'luru's Silk Board-KR Puram line likely to be delayed
135.article_body: Metro work on Bengaluru's Silk Board-KR Puram metro line is likely to be delayed, according to a report. Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation officials have said the delay is caused due to the shifting of gas pipelines at Kadubeesanahalli and KR Puram. "GAIL has assured us of completing the work at the earliest," BMRCL MD Anjum Parwez was quoted as saying.

136.title: Protesters block roads in Armenian capital to call for PM's resignation
136.article_body: Protesters on Wednesday blocked major roads in the Armenian capital Yerevan demanding the resignation of Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan. Protesters also called for citizens to commit acts of civil disobedience. Pashinyan has faced criticism since he agreed to a Russian-brokered ceasefire to end six weeks of war with Azerbaijan over the disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh in November 2020.

137.title: 16-year-old Kailia Posey, grinning girl in popular GIF, dies by suicide
137.article_body: Kailia Posey, who became famous after appearing in TLC's 'Toddlers & Tiaras', has died aged 16. "Unfortunately in one impetuous moment, she made the rash decision to end her earthly life," her family told TMZ. A scene from one of the episodes, in which she grins, became one of the most popular GIFs on the internet.

138.title: Gavaskar returns 20,000 sq ft unused plot given to him 33 years ago by Maha govt
138.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has returned a government plot allotted to him in Mumbai 33 years ago, an official from the Maharashtra housing agency MHADA said. Gavaskar informed the state government he couldn't set up a cricket academy at the 20,000 sq ft plot in Bandra as proposed. The MHADA had requested Gavaskar to return the unused plot last year.

139.title: Mukhtar Ansari's lawyer, son booked for misbehaving with official
139.article_body: Jailed mafia-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari's lawyer Daroga Singh and his son Abbas Ansari have been booked by UP Police for allegedly misbehaving with a revenue worker. The incident occurred during the metering and demarcation of land owned by Singh. The Mau administration said that the land illegally acquired by Singh will be demarcated amid heavy security arrangements.

140.title: Sensex falls over 1,000 points to 55,846 after RBI hikes repo rate to 4.40%
140.article_body: Sensex tanked over 1,000 points and was trading at 55,846 on Wednesday after the RBI announced a hike in the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40%. The Nifty 50 was also down over 330 points and was trading at around 16,736. "We must remain in readiness to use policy tools to preserve macro stability," RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said.

141.title: Man creates ruckus at Chennai de-addiction centre, beaten to death; 7 held
141.article_body: Police have arrested seven people in connection with the death of a 48-year-old man, M Raj, who was admitted to a de-addiction centre in Chennai. Police found out that the man had created a ruckus at the centre, following which, the workers beat him with sticks and other things. Reports said that Raj's family found bruise marks on his body.

142.title: He is IPL legend: Irfan Pathan on Dhawan's 62*(53) vs GT
142.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan called PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan "an IPL legend" after he remained unbeaten at 62 to help them win against GT. "The 15th season is going on and there have only been two seasons where he hasn't scored 300 runs," added Pathan. So far, Dhawan has scored 369 runs in 10 games in IPL 2022.

143.title: MBBS students in Maha told to finish internships in hospitals of own colleges
143.article_body: The Maharashtra University of Health Sciences (MUHS) has asked medical students in the state to compulsorily complete their internships at the hospitals attached to their own institutes. A circular regarding the same was issued on Monday. Earlier, students were allowed to finish internships at hospitals attached to medical colleges other than the ones they had enrolled in for MBBS.

144.title: Film's politics is important, it zeroes down to what's your intention: Kabir
144.article_body: Filmmaker Kabir Khan said he is worried when people in industry say they are apolitical. "The way we frame a character is telling our politics...The politics of a film is very important, as it zeroes down to what is your intention and what do you want to show ultimately," he said, adding one cannot be apolitical as a human being.

145.title: J&K LG lays foundation stone for Amarnath Shrine Board Office in Srinagar
145.article_body: Manoj Sinha, the Lieutenant Governor of Jammu and Kashmir, laid the foundation stone of the Amarnath Shrine Board Office in Srinagar on Tuesday. Earlier on Monday, Nitishwar Kumar, Principal Secretary to the LG had also taken tour of the proposed sites for halt stations like Baltal Base Camp, Domail access point, etc. to ensure smooth conduct of the Amarnath Yatra.

146.title: RBI increases repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40% with immediate effect
146.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday announced that the monetary policy committee has unanimously decided to increase the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40% with immediate effect. Das said that the decision was made after reassessing the inflation growth dynamics and macroeconomic situation. Consequently, the standing deposit facility rate stands adjusted to 4.15%.

147.title: They have the upper hand over RCB: Imran Tahir on 9th placed CSK
147.article_body: Ex-CSK spinner Imran Tahir said CSK who are currently ninth on the IPL 2022 points table, have the upper hand over RCB in their upcoming IPL 2022 match. "RCB will be low on confidence having lost three games," added Tahir. "The match will be very important for CSK," stated Tahir. RCB are currently sixth on the points table.

148.title: 3 labourers die in ammonia tank blast in Goa's Vasco
148.article_body: At least three labourers were killed on the spot after a blast in an ammonia tank at the Zuari Agro Chemicals Limited (ZACL) plant in Goa's Vasco. "The state machinery has immediately responded and is making every effort to bring normalcy to the situation," Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant tweeted. Sawant also assured that there was no gas leakage.

149.title: Brown & beautiful: Samantha on Bridgerton star Simone Ashley's Met Gala look
149.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared a video of 'Bridgerton' season 2 actress, Simone Ashley, from her appearance at the Met Gala 2022 held on Monday. Sharing the video on her Instagram Stories, Samantha wrote, "Brown and beautiful. #SimoneAshley #Bridgerton." The video showed Simone, who played Kate Sharma on 'Bridgerton 2', posing as she arrived on the red carpet.

150.title: MNS workers detained outside Raj Thackeray’s Mumbai home, 9 in Pune
150.article_body: Mumbai Police detained several Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers gathered outside party chief Raj Thackeray's residence, officials said. At least nine MNS workers were also detained when they came out of a temple after performing 'aarti' in Pune, officials added. Notably, Thackeray had asked people to play Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques from May 4 if loudspeakers there were not removed.

151.title: COVID-19 situation not so serious at present: Delhi Health Minister
151.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Wednesday said the COVID-19 situation in the national capital is not so serious at present. "We have reserved 10,000 beds in hospitals for COVID-19 cases, but less than 200 of those are occupied," Jain added. His remarks came a day after Delhi reported 1,414 new COVID-19 cases and one related death.

152.title: EU to ban 3 Russian state-owned broadcasters amid Ukraine war
152.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen said the European Union will ban three Russian state-owned broadcasters as part of a sixth sanctions package over Ukraine war.  "They will not be allowed to distribute their content anymore...in whatever shape or form," she added. She called the channels "mouthpieces that amplify [Russian President Vladimir] Putin's lies and propaganda aggressively".

153.title: My tweets get more replies than Modiji's tweets: Ola CEO on 'troll attacks'
153.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal tweeted, "Ola Electric & I are subject to one of the biggest troll attacks in corporate India." He added, "My tweets now get more replies than even Modiji's tweets despite a fraction of his followers." On Wednesday, a Livemint report claimed that dubious Twitter accounts are defending Ola Electric amid the criticism of the company.

154.title: 13-year-old girl raped by policeman when she went to file rape case in UP
154.article_body: A 13-year-old rape survivor in Uttar Pradesh's Lalitpur was allegedly raped again by the station house officer (SHO) when she went to the police station to file a complaint against four men for kidnapping and gangraping her. The police have lodged a case against six people, including the SHO and her aunt. The aunt and two men have been arrested.

155.title: Actress Amy Jackson dating British actor Ed Westwick: Reports
155.article_body: Actress Amy Jackson is reportedly dating British actor Ed Westwick, who's known for his role as 'Chuck Bass' in 'Gossip Girl'. Pictures have surfaced online where Amy was spotted while taking a walk with Ed in London. Amy and Ed met each other for the first time at Saudi Arabia's Red Sea International Film Festival last December, reports added.

156.title: I am not Rahul, I won't run from Amethi: Irani on contesting from Wayanad
156.article_body: Answering a question on whether she would consider contesting elections from Wayanad if BJP asked her to, Union Minister Smriti Irani said, "I am not Rahul Gandhi, I don't run from Amethi." She said this during her visit to Rahul Gandhi's Lok Sabha constituency Wayanad, where she went to review developmental projects. In 2019, Irani defeated Rahul in Amethi.

157.title: Shigella identified as cause of food poisoning in Kerala girl who died
157.article_body: The Kerala Health Department has identified Shigella bacteria as cause of food poisoning in the 16-year-old girl who died after eating shawarma from local eatery. Thirty other people were also hospitalised after eating from the eatery. The District medical officer Dr S K Ramdas said presence of shigella was confirmed after testing the blood and faeces of the patients.

158.title: ICC release team rankings for all formats after annual update
158.article_body: The ICC today released team rankings after the annual update. Australia increased their lead over second-placed India from one to nine rating points in Test rankings. In ODI rankings, New Zealand remain on top, but their lead over England is reduced to one rating point. India remain on top in T20Is, extending their lead over second-placed England to five points.

159.title: Neighbours clash over trivial issues in Delhi's Shahbad; FIRs filed
159.article_body: Delhi Police filed cross FIRs against two neighbours, Kamalkant and Azad, for allegedly fighting over trivial issues and assaulting each other near Peer Baba Mazar in Delhi's Shahbad Dairy area on Tuesday. According to police, first, Azad and his friends attacked Kamalkant and his family at his residence, following which Kamalkant and his friends attacked Azad and his family members.

160.title: Defeat against PBKS bitter pill to swallow: GT's David Miller
160.article_body: GT batter David Miller said their defeat against PBKS on Tuesday was quite a "bitter pill to swallow". He, however, also added, "It's going to happen through the campaign...with so many games. So, hopefully, we got the bad game out the way." Miller, who has scored 287 runs in 10 games this season, got out for 11 runs against PBKS.

161.title: I feel sorry for Ravindra Jadeja but CSK are on the backfoot: Brad Hogg
161.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja who recently stepped down as CSK captain, ex-KKR spinner Brad Hogg said, "I feel sorry for Jadeja. Jadeja...didn't have the full quota of players. So that's put extra pressure." "But at the end of the day, CSK are on the backfoot. They have made the move," added Hogg. MS Dhoni replaced Jadeja as CSK captain.

162.title: Police release photos of man accused in acid attack in Bengaluru
162.article_body: Kamakshipalya Police have released pictures of the acid attack accused, Nagesh Babu, in different looks and sought help from public to arrest him. Babu has been absconding since last Thursday after he allegedly threw acid on a 24-year-old woman in Bengaluru's Sunkadakatte after she rejected his marriage proposal. Police have formed seven teams comprising over 100 policemen to arrest him.

163.title: There's peace in Maharashtra, no protest being held: Sanjay Raut
163.article_body: There is peace in Maharashtra and no protest is being held in the state, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said on Wednesday. "No illegal loudspeakers running in the state...Bal Thackeray and Veer Savarkar are the ones who taught Hindutva to the country." Raut added. "Shiv Sena's school of Hindutva is original," Raut stated.

164.title: Couple booked days after burnt body of 33-yr-old man found in Punjab
164.article_body: Seven days after the burnt body of a 33-year-old man was found in Punjab’s Lalru, police booked a couple in connection with the case. Police recovered the body from a secluded place on April 26. On that day, the deceased man’s brother was told by the accused that they dropped the victim off in Zirakpur.

165.title: Russia learning from early mistakes in Ukraine war, will improve: US
165.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said that Russia is learning from its mistakes in the early stages of the Ukraine war and will improve their logistical efforts. "We saw them make some bad assumptions at the beginning…We saw them fail to integrate aerial fires with their ground maneuver…We'll see them improve their massing of fires," Austin told the US Congress.

166.title: Astrologers, priests in Telangana decide not to fix muhurta for C-section
166.article_body: Astrologers and priests in Telangana's Karimnagar have joined hands to support the government's initiative to promote normal deliveries and not fix muhurta for the delivery of babies through Caesarean section (C-section). "It has become a practice for people to...fix auspicious time..for deliveries. C-section is advisable only when normal delivery becomes complicated," the District Collector said.

167.title: Akshay Kumar completes 30 years in B'wood; Prithviraj makers unveil poster
167.article_body: Akshay Kumar recently completed 30 years in the Hindi film industry and Yash Raj Films celebrated the actor's special milestone by creating a new 'Prithviraj' poster that features every film that he has been a part of. In the video, Akshay is seen saying, "It didn't...cross my mind that this activity is happening to celebrate my 30 years in cinema!"

168.title: ITBP personnel perform Yoga at height of 17,000 ft in Sikkim Himalayas
168.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel participated in a Yoga session on Wednesday at an altitude of 17,000 feet amid snow conditions in Sikkim Himalayas, ahead of the International Day of Yoga 2022. A group of around 20 personnel of ITBP were seen performing at least three different Yoga asanas (postures).

169.title: Mother, son die as car collides with tractor in Greater Noida
169.article_body: A 70-year-old woman and her 35-year-old son died as their car collided with a tractor that allegedly came on the wrong lane of an expressway in UP's Greater Noida, police said. The victims were returning to Haryana after purchasing medicines from Meerut, police added. The tractor took a sudden turn and the car crashed into its front portion, police stated.

170.title: Queen of Denmark Margrethe II hosts dinner for PM Modi at Amalienborg Palace
170.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was accorded a warm welcome by the Queen of the Kingdom of Denmark, Margrethe II at Amalienborg Palace in Copenhagen on the second day of his Europe visit. PM Modi also attended a private dinner hosted by the Queen. He felicitated Her Majesty on the occasion of the Golden Jubilee of her reign, the MEA stated.

171.title: Ukraine will win the war: UK PM Boris Johnson
171.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson on Tuesday said that Ukraine will win the war against Russia. "I have one message for you today - Ukraine will win, Ukraine will be free," said Johnson in a virtual address to the Ukrainian Parliament. "This is Ukraine's finest hour, that will be remembered and recounted for generations to come," he added.

172.title: Shatrughan Sinha and family performed black magic on me, ran 'sex scam': Pooja Mishra
172.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 5' contestant Pooja Mishra, in a recent interview, claimed that veteran actor Shatrughan Sinha and his family performed magic on her. She also claimed that they used to make her unconscious and trade her in a 'sex scam'. She further alleged that they blocked 35 films of her from releasing.

173.title: Ranveer Singh's 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' to release with 0 cuts: Report
173.article_body: Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' has reportedly received a U/A certificate from the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC). "Ranveer is seen threatening to castrate himself in a scene," said a source as quoted by the report. "They gave a clean U/A to the film without asking for any sort of cut," added the source.

174.title: Arshdeep has got a lot of nerve, he has shown that in death overs: Rabada
174.article_body: PBKS pacer Kagiso Rabada has praised his teammate Arshdeep Singh, stating that the 23-year-old has got a lot of "nerve" and he's showing that while bowling in the death overs.
