"Arshdeep reads the game well, he's able to execute his skill and he's done it game in game out," added Rabada. Arshdeep has picked four wickets in 10 games.

175.title: Delhi Police to take action against its personnel who were absent on Eid
175.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday said departmental action would be taken against its personnel of the 'Third Battalion' who were absent on Eid. About 500 personnel of the battalion were deployed across the city on the occasion of Eid, an official said. Notably, tight security arrangements were put in place at major religious places for peaceful progression of namaz.

176.title: Married Australia-returnee among 2 held for stalking Mohali girl
176.article_body: Two men were arrested for allegedly stalking a girl outside Chandigarh’s MCM DAV College in Sector 36. One of the accused recently returned from Australia and started working with an advocate in Mohali, police said. He also recently got married. The victim, a Mohali resident, said that the incident occurred while she was waiting for her father outside the college.

177.title: Father booked for 5-yr-old son's death in bike accident in Panvel
177.article_body: A 36-year-old man has been booked after his five-year-old son died in a bike accident in Panvel near Mumbai. The man was riding the bike while his wife and older son were riding pillion. The deceased child was sitting on the petrol tank when the bike collided with a wall and fell outside a bridge, causing injuries to all.

178.title: Hoped Telugu version wouldn't release, dubbing wasn't good: Director on 'Raja..'
178.article_body: Dharmesh Darshan, director of 'Raja Hindustani', said that he hoped that the producers wouldn't release the film's Telugu version. "The dubbing quality was not good...If a better quality of dubbing was done, it would have become a hit even in the Telugu version...When it failed, everybody agreed that the director was correct," he added.

179.title: Heavy rains lash parts of Hyderabad, waterlogging in many areas
179.article_body: Heavy rains lashed parts of Hyderabad on Wednesday morning causing waterlogging in many areas. Seethafalmandi near Secunderabad received 72.8 mm rainfall, the highest as of 6 am, as per official data. DRF teams have been deployed to clear water stagnations and treefalls, and provide assistance to citizens. Thundershowers are likely to occur in parts of Telangana, IMD said.

180.title: 24-year-old man arrested for raping cousin's wife in Pune
180.article_body: A 24-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping his cousin's wife at her house in Pune. The accused had allegedly barged into the 26-year-old woman's house at around 2 am on April 30 and raped her after threatening to tell her husband about their Instagram chats. The accused was arrested after the victim lodged an FIR on Tuesday.

181.title: North Korea fires unidentified projectile into sea, 14th launch this year
181.article_body: North Korea fired an unidentified projectile toward the sea off its east coast on Wednesday, South Korea's military said. Japan's Coast Guard said it could be a ballistic missile. The launch, which marks North Korea's 14th weapons test this year, comes days after North Korean leader Kim Jong-un vowed to bolster his nuclear arsenal "at the fastest possible pace".

182.title: Raj Thackeray shares Bal Thackeray's video amid Hanuman Chalisa row
182.article_body: Amid the Azaan-Hanuman Chalisa row, MNS chief Raj Thackeray tweeted Bal Thackeray's video in which the latter is heard saying that if our government comes to power then we will stop namaz on roads and remove loudspeakers from masjids. Raj Thackeray had appealed to Hindus to play Hanuman Chalisa in places where they hear Azaan being done on loudspeakers today.

183.title: Maha MP Navneet Rana, husband Ravi Rana get bail in Hanuman Chalisa case
183.article_body: Maharashtra's Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her MLA-husband Ravi Rana, who were arrested in connection with the Hanuman Chalisa row, have been granted bail by a Mumbai court. They were arrested on April 23 after they announced to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside CM Uddhav Thackeray's private residence 'Matoshree'. A court had sent the couple to judicial custody till May 6.

184.title: There's need for security agencies to have quick access to info: Shah
184.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said there is a need for legal and security agencies to have automated, secure and immediate access to information obtained from reliable sources. "Security requirements today have changed significantly as compared to the earlier security challenges in terms of data, scope and complexity," Shah added.

185.title: Nothing left, haven't eaten in 3 days: Vendor on Banjara Market demolition
185.article_body: Sushila, one of the vendors in Gurugram's Banjara Market, where demolition drive was undertaken recently, said that they have nothing left and that they haven't eaten or taken bath in three days. Another vendor, Chini, said that she was cooking when the machine demolished her house. "They've made us homeless...there has been loss of lakhs and crores," another vendor said.

186.title: BSF personnel injured in accidental firing from his own rifle in Bhuj
186.article_body: A Border Security Force (BSF) personnel was injured after an accidental firing from his own rifle due to rough weather in the sea near Gujarat's Bhuj. "While depositing the weapon...due to extremely high turbulence...Constable Pratap fell down on...the Floating Border Out-Post and accidentally one round got fired from his service rifle piercing the right side of his abdomen," BSF said.

187.title: It’s his woman, those are Kanye’s kids: Hughley on Pete's new tattoo
187.article_body: Discussing the new tattoo of Kim Kardashian's boyfriend Pete Davidson, actor DL Hughley said, "It's his woman, those are Kanye West's kids. If you tattooed my kids on your neck, I would have something to say about it." "That would piss me off," added Hughley. "If you...got my kids tattooed...look, they will always be mine," stated Hughley.

188.title: Another Durgapur-bound SpiceJet flight faces technical issue, returns to Chennai
188.article_body: A Durgapur-bound SpiceJet flight had to return to Chennai after take-off last night due to a technical issue, a SpiceJet spokesperson told the Hindustan Times. The flight reportedly took off after a delay of 6.5 hours. The incident comes after another SpiceJet flight to Durgapur from Mumbai was hit by severe turbulence on Sunday in which 40 people were injured.

189.title: 'Koffee with Karan' will not be returning, announces Karan Johar
189.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar today announced his talk show 'Koffee with Karan' will not be returning.   "Koffee with Karan has been a part of my life, and yours, for 6 seasons now. I'd like to think we've made an impact and even found our place in pop culture history," Johar said. The last season of the show ended in March 2019.

190.title: When I didn't do well, Deepak Chahar called me, gave me tips: Mukesh
190.article_body: CSK pacer Mukesh Choudhary has revealed that their ₹14-crore buy Deepak Chahar, who was ruled out of IPL 2022 due to injury concerns, has been in touch with him and has been guiding him in the ongoing IPL season. "In the initial matches of the tournament, I did not do well. Deepak Bhai called and gave me tips," added Choudhary.

191.title: 24-year-old woman raped, stabbed by 2 men in Gurugram; 1 arrested
191.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was allegedly raped and stabbed by two men in Gurugram's DLF Phase-3 area, police said on Tuesday. "On Monday, I got a desperate call from my wife...When I reached home, she told me she was raped by two [men]...one of them stabbed her," victim's husband said. Police have arrested one accused in connection with the case.

192.title: I sometimes pissed him off: France's Gael Monfils on Novak Djokovic
192.article_body: French tennis player Gael Monfils said he sometimes "pissed off" world number one Novak Djokovic. "Maybe you can beat him once, twice, three times. Me, I never succeeded. But there aren't many guys who beat Usain Bolt," added Monfils. "He has a way of playing that I don't like. Djokovic manages to find my weaknesses every time," stated Monfils.

193.title: UP displayed 'Ganga-Jamuni tehzeeb' during festivities: ADG Prashant Kumar
193.article_body: The people of Uttar Pradesh displayed "traditional Ganga-Jamuni tehzeeb" while celebrating three festivals in a single day, ADG (Law and Order) Prashant Kumar said. "No untoward incident of any kind took place anywhere in the state and people celebrated Eid with traditional fervour and gaiety," he added. Namaz was peacefully offered at around 32,000 places in UP, he further informed.

194.title: Acid attack on woman in Bengaluru was planned well in advance: Police
194.article_body: The acid attack on a 24-year-old woman in Bengaluru was planned "well in advance", the police said. "We have taken the case seriously and our teams have been dispatched across the state and outside the state as well," Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said. The victim sustained serious burns due to acid attack and is undergoing treatment at a hospital.

195.title: Curbs on media, civil society undermine Pakistan's image: US
195.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said that restrictions on media and civil society in Pakistan undermine the country's image and its ability to progress. The statement comes after Pakistan fell to 157th position on the World Press Freedom Index. "A vibrant free press, an informed citizenry are key for any nation and its future, including Pakistan," said Blinken.

196.title: Putin signs decree allowing Russia to terminate exports and deals with the West
196.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has put the West on notice that Russia can terminate exports and deals in response to the sanctions imposed on it over Ukraine's invasion. Putin signed a decree which forbids the export of products and raw materials to people and entities on a sanctions list that he ordered the government to draw up within 10 days.

197.title: Removal of loudspeakers falls under Delhi Police's jurisdiction: AAP
197.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) said that the matter of removal of loudspeakers from religious places falls under Delhi Police's jurisdiction which is under BJP-ruled Cente. "AAP in principle agrees with the concept of repealing loudspeakers from every religious institution," the party said. This comes after BJP wrote to CM Arvind Kejriwal urging him to immediately remove loudspeakers from religious places.

198.title: Grew up before my age, had to be strong as mom, brother were soft: Tejasswi
198.article_body: Actress Tejasswi Prakash said she grew way before her age as her father was away for work during her childhood. “My mother was...soft and emotional person. Pratik [her brother] was very soft...and I used to always have to be...that strong person in...the house,” she said, adding her mother used to lock them in house so they wouldn’t get lost.

199.title: Haryana to distribute 5 lakh free tablets to students from May 5
199.article_body: Haryana government will distribute free tablets to 5 lakh students studying in classes 10 to 12 in government schools from May 5, an official statement read. These devices will come with personalised and adaptive learning software, preloaded content and free internet data. "The scheme will prove to be an effective step towards online education," Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar said.

200.title: Never seen a six as big as that one: Pietersen on Livingstone's 117-metre six
200.article_body: Reacting to PBKS all-rounder Liam Livingstone's 117-metre six off GT pacer Mohammad Shami, ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen said, "I've never seen a six as big as that one." Livingstone smashed three sixes and two fours in his unbeaten 30-run innings. "Nice to go out and hit a few out the middle," said Livingstone after the game.

201.title: City can win 2nd leg vs Madrid playing way worse than 1st leg: Guardiola
201.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said his team can win the second leg of their Champions League semi-final against Real Madrid, despite playing "much, much worse" than their performance in the first leg. "Football is unpredictable," added Guardiola. City defeated Real Madrid 4-3 in the first leg with Kevin De Bruyne, Bernardo Silva among the goalscorers.

202.title: Protests erupt in Germany after man dies during police operation
202.article_body: Hundreds of people reportedly staged protests in Germany after a man died during a police operation. In purported videos that surfaced following the incident, a police officer appeared to hit the man in the head. The authorities said that the man, who was stopped by the police, refused to cooperate, after which the officers used force.

203.title: Imran Khan attends cousin Ira Khan's Eid celebrations, pic surfaces
203.article_body: Imran Khan, who had quit acting in 2018, was seen in a picture shared by his cousin Ira Khan from her Eid celebrations. The former actor was spotted wearing a pathani kurta-pyjama in the photo. Ira captioned the post, "Did you know you're eligible for Eidi till you're married?! I thought once you're an adult (18) it's done."

204.title: Hyd IAS officer says someone asking for money in his name, says 'not me'
204.article_body: IAS officer from Hyderabad, Arvind Kumar, took to Twitter to share a screenshot with a number, claiming that someone was sending messages in his name. "Someone is sending messages...asking for money from my staff/others!! Upon being informed, I have filed immediately a police complaint. It's not me and please ignore any message if received," he wrote.

205.title: 37-yr-old man kills friend, chops off body & dumps in Ludhiana canal
205.article_body: A 37-year-old man was arrested for allegedly murdering his friend and cutting the body into several pieces before dumping in Ludhiana. The parts of victim's dismembered body were recovered from Sidhwan Canal. The accused allegedly killed the 30-year-old victim at his rented room on April 18. He purportedly killed him with intention to rob ₹25,000 cash from him, police said.

206.title: Sidharth Malhotra, Kiara Advani spotted together at Eid bash amid breakup reports
206.article_body: Actors Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani were spotted together at Arpita Khan's Eid bash amid breakup reports. The two posed separately for the photographers upon their arrival, but went inside the venue together. "Rumours smashed," a fan commented on a video of them entering the venue together. "They look amazing together," another wrote.

207.title: Batting first wasn't wrong, we needed to get out of our comfort zone: Hardik
207.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya said batting first after winning the toss against PBKS wasn't a wrong call as he wanted his team to get out of their comfort zone. He added, "We've chased well in this tournament, if required (later on), we had to know how to set targets." GT managed to post 143/8 and lost by eight wickets.

208.title: 'Fake priest' spends night at army barracks near Queen Elizabeth's castle
208.article_body: The UK Army has launched an investigation following reports that a man pretending to be a priest spent a night at a barracks with soldiers tasked with protecting Queen Elizabeth II near her Windsor Castle home. He allegedly spent the night eating and drinking with soldiers. The Queen was not in castle when the incident reportedly took place last Wednesday.

209.title: Mamata will be PM in 2024, Abhishek CM, says TMC MP; deletes tweet
209.article_body: TMC MP Aparupa Poddar on Tuesday tweeted, "In 2024, Mamata Banerjee will be sworn in as the Prime Minister by an RSS-selected President; Abhishek Banerjee will become the Chief Minister of Bengal." She deleted the tweet later. Asked about it by mediapersons, Poddar said, "It is true that we want to see Mamata Banerjee becoming the PM in 2024."

210.title: Odisha govt transfers ₹800 cr financial assistance to 40 lakh farmers
210.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Tuesday transferred ₹800 crore directly to the bank account of 40 lakh farmers of the state as financial assistance. "Development of agriculture and farmers' welfare is the most important program of the state government," he said. "This year more than ₹20,000 crore has been provided in the budget for agriculture," Patnaik further said.

211.title: Was told to leave via back door, angry Kanpur crowd broke shop's glass: Divyenndu
211.article_body: Actor Divyenndu said he was asked to leave via the back door while shooting at a cyber cafe in Kanpur because "it was really crowded" outside. "These guys [people outside] really got angry so they broke the glass of the shop...In Mumbai...when I step out, people recognise me...but they are more civil...and don't really encroach upon your territory," he added.

212.title: Turn your home into a smart home with Alexa Smart Home Combo: Amazon
212.article_body: With the launch of the Amazon Summer Sale on May 4, Amazon announced that customers can now convert their home into a smart home with Alexa Smart Home Combo at an unbelievable price of ₹2,999. The Alexa Smart Home Combo requires no rewiring and is easy to install, letting customers experience the convenience of hands-free voice control, the company added.

213.title: India's largest IPO of LIC opens for subscription
213.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) IPO, which is India's largest, opened for subscription today. The price band of the IPO is ₹902-949, with a ₹60 discount for policyholders and ₹45 discount for retail investors and employees. The IPO, through which the government is selling its 3.5% LIC stake to raise ₹20,557 crore, will close for subscription on May 9.

214.title: India registered 6% rise in deaths in pandemic year 2020: CRS data
214.article_body: India registered 81.16 lakh deaths in 2020, during the COVID-19 pandemic year, which is about 6% higher than the previous year’s number, as per the data released by the Civil Registration System (CRS). India registered 76.41 lakh deaths in 2019. The number of registered births in 2020 declined from 2.48 crore in 2019 to 2.42 crore, according to the data.

215.title: Mumbai witnesses rise in viral diarrhoea cases among children
215.article_body: There is an unusual rise in number of viral infection cases among children, especially diarrhoea, which is one of the causes of dehydration, Mumbai's paediatricians said. "Daily, we are seeing 5 to 10 cases of diarrhoea in children," paediatrician Dr Vishal Parmar said. The diarrhoea cases in children are more this year compared to the last two years, he added.

216.title: Deepika, Ranveer, Kangana and Karan Johar attend Eid party, pics surface
216.article_body: Several celebrities including actors Deepika Padukone, Ranveer Singh, Kangana Ranaut and Karan Johar attended Arpita Khan's Eid party on Tuesday. Kangana was decked up in a white sharara. Meanwhile, Deepika was seen in a black embroidered kurta salwar and Ranveer donned a colourful printed shirt. The duo also posed for the paparazzi. Karan attended the party wearing a black kurta.

217.title: We're trying to get best out of Bairstow, so I said, 'I'll bat at no. 4': Mayank
217.article_body: After their win against GT, PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal said there's no better time to get back-to-back wins in the ongoing IPL season. On demoting himself in batting order while chasing GT's 143-run total, Mayank said, "We're trying to get the best out of Jonny Bairstow. He's done well opening...[so] I said, 'I'll bat at four, I'll anchor the innings'."

218.title: CBI inspects Kerala CM's house in sexual abuse case against Chandy
218.article_body: CBI on Tuesday conducted an inspection at the Cliff House, Kerala Chief Minister's official residence, to collect evidence in connection with the sexual abuse case against former CM Oommen Chandy. Five Congress leaders, including Chandy, are accused of sexually abusing the prime woman accused in the solar panel scam. Chandy had allegedly sexually abused her at Cliff House in 2012.

219.title: 43-year-old man arrested with Mephedrone worth over ₹11 lakh in Pune
219.article_body: The Pune unit of the Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) has arrested a 43-year-old man, a resident of Mumbai, and seized 118 grams of Mephedrone worth over ₹11 lakh from him. Acting on a tip-off, the ATS laid a trap to arrest the accused near the Pune railway station on Monday afternoon. The ATS has launched a search for his three accomplices.

220.title: Armed men posing as police officers, rob ₹65,000 from Ambala ashram
220.article_body: Five masked men armed with weapons and sticks posed as police officers from a nearby station and allegedly robbed two priests of ₹65,000 at an ashram in Ambala's Khatauli village on Monday around 1:30 am. "They started thrashing us and took away...cash from the almirah. They also snatched gold...silver jewellery from us...and seven mobile phones," one of the priests said.

221.title: India sees 3,205 new COVID-19 cases, a jump of 24.8% in daily cases
221.article_body: India has reported 3,205 COVID-19 cases, 2,802 recoveries and 31 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,568 COVID-19 cases and 20 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,509, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,920.

222.title: Withdraw cases against Dalits or Gujarat Bandh on June 1: Mevani
222.article_body: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani has called for a statewide bandh on June 1 if the government does not withdraw cases filed against Dalits for protesting over the 2016 Una flogging incident. Addressing a rally in Ahmedabad, Mevani said, "The cases should be withdrawn the way cases related to Patidar agitation were withdrawn."

223.title: Liverpool enter Champions League final for 3rd time in 5 yrs
223.article_body: Liverpool defeated Villarreal 3-2 in their Champions League semi-final second leg, winning the tie 5-2 on aggregate. This is the third time in five years that Liverpool have entered the Champions League final. Notably, Jurgen Klopp's side also broke their single-season goalscoring record in the match. They have now scored 139 goals in 57 games in all competitions this season.

224.title: On-field players' reactions to IPL 2022's biggest six go viral
224.article_body: PBKS batting all-rounder Liam Livingstone smashed the biggest six of IPL 2022 off GT pacer Mohammad Shami on Tuesday. After the ball covered a distance of 117 metres, reactions of several players including Shami and PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal went viral. Shami was seen smiling, while Agarwal seemed shocked. Meanwhile, GT vice-captain Rashid Khan was seen checking Livingstone's bat.

225.title: My son Ibrahim says he looks like young Saif: Saif on their similar looks
225.article_body: Speaking about him and his son having strikingly similar looks, actor Saif Ali Khan said, "He also says I look like...young Saif." "[Ibrahim] sent me a picture of him, looking good and said this is what I'd look like if I was a 20-year-old 'Vikram Vedha' actor," he added. Saif said that he hopes his son's future goes well.

226.title: Rafael Nadal is my greatest rival of all time: Novak Djokovic
226.article_body: World number one Novak Djokovic said Spain's Rafael Nadal is his "greatest" rival of all time. "We have not been in the same draw for a while," added Djokovic. "We are both trying to do our best to compete for the top spots of the world," stated Djokovic. "I think we are still going strong," said Djokovic.

227.title: India working towards making its airports carbon neutral: Scindia
227.article_body: India is working towards making its airports carbon neutral in the near future, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said. India is working in this direction to emerge as a responsible player in the international civil aviation industry, Scindia added. "With a robust and holistic plan for the future, we are sure, we will set new milestones in air, soon," Scindia stated.

228.title: Guj govt is 'nikamma', Assam Police kidnapping MLA an insult: Jignesh
228.article_body: Dalit leader and MLA Jignesh Mevani called the Gujarat government "nikamma" and said that the Assam Police kidnapping an MLA is an insult to the 6.5 crore people of Gujarat. "You could do nothing when the Assam police came to Gujarat to trample upon its pride. You should be ashamed of it," he added.

229.title: Aviation sector showed resilience by bouncing back post-COVID: Scindia
229.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Tuesday said that the manner in which Indian civil aviation has bounced back post-COVID-19, with all protocols in place, shows its resilience and determination. "Pre-COVID-19, the maximum number of passengers per day in India was roughly 4,00,000. Ten days ago, we touched the figure of 4,07,000," Scindia added.

230.title: People will watch good content, we shouldn't just crave for our gains: Amit
230.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh said OTT has an understanding and a process which is going ahead smoothly. "The theatrical releases were halted due to COVID-19. Thus...filmmakers were suffering," added Amit. "Whenever good content is made, people will watch it. We should not just crave for our gains," stated Amit. "The industry need not belong to a particular production house," said Amit.

231.title: Man attacks friend for refusing to lend ₹50 in south Mumbai; held
231.article_body: A 30-year-old daily wage worker was allegedly attacked in south Mumbai by an acquaintance of his, after he denied to give him ₹50 for some personal work. The incident occurred near Yellow Gate when the victim refused to lend money, following which the accused attacked him with a knife. Subsequently, a police team reached the spot and arrested the accused.

232.title: Over 6,000 trees blossom with state flower across Mumbai
232.article_body: The Tamhan, which is the state flower of Maharashtra, has started blooming across Mumbai, including entrance of BMC headquarters. "It blooms every year during this season, especially around Maharashtra Day. There are a total of 6,568 Tamhan trees across Mumbai," head of the BMC's garden department said. The tree has many medical uses, another official from the garden department said.

233.title: He flung in air, they ran over him: Friend of Noida's road rage victim
233.article_body: Himanshu Agrawal, friend of Divakar Motwani who was hit by a car in Noida in alleged road rage incident on Saturday, said Divakar had "flung into air" after being hit. "Then they ran over him," Agrawal said. Five persons were arrested for allegedly running over Motwani. The victim continues to be critical with head injuries and multiple leg fractures.

234.title: Minor held for 77-yr-old man's murder, robbery in Delhi's Civil Lines
234.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday arrested a 16-year-old boy for the murder of a 77-year-old man in North Delhi's Civil Lines area. Ram Kishore Agrawal was found dead at his home on Sunday and around ₹50 lakh were found to be stolen from his house. Police arrested the accused by scanning over 300 CCTV cameras and tracing his metro card.

235.title: Bengaluru reports 100 of Karnataka's 107 new COVID-19 cases
235.article_body: Karnataka on Tuesday reported 107 new COVID-19 cases, out of which 100 were reported in Bengaluru alone. The city also reported 103 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). The number of active cases in Bengaluru now stands at 1,728 with a positivity rate of 1.67%, the data showed.

236.title: 97 arrested in Jodhpur after clashes on Eid, curfew in several areas
236.article_body: As many as 97 people have been arrested in connection with the clashes that broke out at Jalori Gate in Rajasthan's Jodhpur on Eid. Curfew remains in 10 police station areas and internet services have been suspended. The reason for the escalation of tensions resulted from one community hoisting an Eid flag over a freedom fighter's statue, police added.

237.title: As Yamuna water depletes, Delhi requests Haryana to share more
237.article_body: The Delhi Jal Board (DJB) wrote a second letter to the Haryana Irrigation Department in a week, requesting it to release additional water. The DJB said that the Yamuna water level at Wazirabad pond has dropped by about two feet, which could affect water production adversely. It requested for an additional 150 cusecs of water till the arrival of monsoon.

238.title: Cylinder explodes in a shanty in Mohali; 4 injured
238.article_body: Four persons were injured in fire after a cylinder exploded in a shanty near Phase-10 in Mohali on Tuesday around 10 pm. "The fire broke out due to gas leakage, following which the cylinder exploded," police said. Some labourers were reportedly cooking food in the shanty at that time. The injured people were taken to a government hospital, police said.

239.title: Mangoes get QR codes to help Pune buyers know trees they're picked from
239.article_body: QR codes have been stuck on mangoes at the mango festival organised by the MahaFPC in Pune. The QR code aims to provide the buyers with source information about the fruits including which tree they were picked from. Reports said that unique QR codes are generated for mangoes and the information about the harvest is fed into the system.

240.title: Hyderabad Police busts organised cricket betting racket, 8 arrested
240.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Monday busted an organised cricket betting racket and arrested eight people in Secunderabad's Sindhi Colony. Police also seized ₹4.5 lakh in cash from the accused persons. "One of the accused and his team procured and set up online cricket betting equipment such as a call connector box, laptop and cell phones inside his car," police added.

241.title: Liam Livingstone smashes the biggest six of IPL 2022, IPL share video
241.article_body: PBKS batting all-rounder Liam Livingstone smashed a 117-metre maximum on the bowling of GT fast bowler Mohammad Shami to record the biggest six of IPL 2022 so far. The previous biggest six of the tournament was hit by MI's 19-year-old batter Dewald Brevis, who had smashed a 112-metre six against PBKS leg-spinner Rahul Chahar.

242.title: Twitter may charge slight fee for commercial, government users: Musk
242.article_body: Elon Musk has said that Twitter will always be free for casual users but may charge a slight fee for commercial and government users. After the Tesla CEO struck a deal to buy Twitter, he said he wanted to enhance the platform with new features, make the algorithms open source to increase trust, defeat spam bots, and authenticate all humans.

243.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature on Tuesday released
243.article_body: The highest maximum temperature in the country on Tuesday was reported at Wardha and Rajnandgaon at 44.5°C each. No heat wave was recorded in the country on Tuesday. Maharashtra's Chandrapur witnessed the maximum temperature of 44.4°C, with a total of six stations across the country reporting maximum temperature of 44°C or more.

244.title: 21-yr-old student stabbed to death by ex-boyfriend in West Bengal
244.article_body: A 21-year-old student, Sutapa Chowdhury, was stabbed to death outside her college mess in West Bengal's Berhampore. As per the preliminary investigation, the police suspect the alleged killer, 22-year-old Sushanta Chowdhury, to be her ex-boyfriend. They said that the accused, who was arrested following the incident, has confessed to the crime. The incident was reportedly caught on CCTV camera.

245.title: 8-month-old boy found dead in rooftop water tank in Delhi's Dallupura
245.article_body: An eight-month-old boy drowned in a rooftop water tank in Delhi's Dallupura on Tuesday, police said. The incident took place when his mother went outside leaving her three kids in a room which was latched from outside, police added. Police are investigating how the child reached the roof when the room was locked from the outside, an officer said.

246.title: PBKS hand GT their 2nd defeat of IPL 2022, jump to 5th on points table
246.article_body: PBKS chased down the 144-run target against GT in 16 overs to register their fifth win in IPL 2022. With the win, PBKS jumped to the fifth position on the points table. Table-toppers GT have now lost two matches in IPL 2022. Shikhar Dhawan top-scored for PBKS with 62*(53), while Liam Livingstone smashed an unbeaten 30 off 10 deliveries.

247.title: Delhi reports 1,414 COVID-19 cases & 1 death in last 24 hrs
247.article_body: Delhi reported 1,414 new COVID-19 cases and one related death in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,87,050. The national capital reported 1,171 recoveries and the active cases stand at 5,986, while the positivity rate is 5.97%. Delhi on Monday had reported 1,076 COVID-19 cases and no related deaths.

248.title: Ninth accused in Noida mall fight that led to man's death arrested
248.article_body: Noida Police said that the ninth accused was arrested in the mall fight case, in which 30-year-old Brijesh Rai was beaten to death at Lost Lemons pub at Gardens Galleria mall. The accused, Jaiveer Singh, a native of Haryana's Jind district, worked at the bar and was arrested from a bus stand at the Mahamaya flyover.

249.title: Delhi sees maximum temperature of 38.4°C; IMD predicts dust storm tomorrow
249.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted a possibility of dust storm or thunderstorm with partly cloudy sky in Delhi on Wednesday. The minimum and maximum temperatures in the city on Wednesday are likely to settle at 27°C and 40°C, respectively, as per IMD data. The maximum temperature in the national capital was recorded at 38.4°C on Tuesday.

250.title: Absolutely: Vettori on whether players should be allowed to review wides
250.article_body: On being asked whether players should be allowed to review wides, ex-New Zealand captian Daniel Vettori said, "Abosutely. The players should be able to decide in such crucial matters." He added, "That's why DRS was brought in...to rectify mistakes. I'd like to see that happen...and players are very good judges of that. They get it right more often than not."

251.title: Ukrainian nurse who lost both legs shares dance with husband, govt shares video
251.article_body: A 23-year-old Ukrainian nurse who lost her legs in a Russian landmine explosion shared the first dance with her husband after getting married in a Lviv hospital. Victor, the groom, carried wife Oksana in his arms as they danced in a ward. Calling it a "very special love story", Ukrainian Parliament tweeted that the woman is preparing for prosthetic surgery.

252.title: Nadal is an outlier: Spanish Tennis Federation President Diaz
252.article_body: Spanish Tennis Federation Miguel Diaz has praised Rafael Nadal, saying the 21-time Grand Slam champion is an "outlier". He stated, "At one point, he was half limping into training. To win what you have won is extraordinary," he added. The Spaniard has won three titles so far in 2022. He will be playing at the Madrid Open this week.

253.title: Necessary to get out of consumption oriented approach: PM Modi
253.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said it's necessary for the world to get out of consumption oriented approach. "The need of the hour is to promote 'LIFE -- Lifestyle for Environment'...The mindset of use and throw is negative for the planet...The amount of resources we consume must depend on our need, not on our pocket's size," PM Modi said.

254.title: Fire breaks out at scrap godown of MCD office in Delhi
254.article_body: A major fire broke out in the scrap godown of MCD office in Delhi's Keshav Puram on Tuesday evening, officials said. According to fire officials, information regarding the fire was received at 5:25 pm, following which eight to nine fire tenders were rushed to the spot. Short-circuit is suspected to be the reason behind the fire, an NDMC official said.

255.title: Germany's Opposition leader visits Ukraine's Kyiv amid war
255.article_body: Germany's Opposition leader Friedrich Merz travelled to Ukraine's Kyiv on Tuesday for meetings with Ukrainian officials. Speaking to reporters in Irpin, on the outskirts of Kyiv, Merz expressed his "full admiration" for the Ukrainian military for having halted the Russian advance at the town. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is yet to visit Kyiv despite visits from several European leaders.

256.title: Taiwan seeks timely delivery of Stinger missiles from US
256.article_body: Taiwan's Defence Ministry on Tuesday said that deliveries of shoulder-fired Stinger anti-aircraft missiles from the US could be delayed, amid pressure on supplies due to the war in Ukraine. There is a high demand for missiles in Ukraine, where they've been very successful against Russian aircraft, according to Reuters. The ministry said that it's pressing for timely delivery of missiles.

257.title: Finishers stepping up is main reason behind GT's success: Rajput
257.article_body: Discussing the form of GT's finishers in IPL 2022, Lalchand Rajput said, "In a team, if you've got two or three finishers and if one gets out...other two can continue the momentum." He added this is what's making GT successful as skipper Hardik Pandya is an "excellent finisher". Rajput called Rahul Tewatia one of the best finishers in recent times.

258.title: RPI(A) will protect mosques if loudspeakers are removed: Minister
258.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Tuesday said workers of his Republican Party of India (A) will protect mosques if anyone tried to remove loudspeakers from there forcibly. "We are not against playing Hanuman Chalisa outside a mosque. If Raj Thackeray gives an ultimatum to have these loudspeakers removed, then workers of my party will protect mosques," Athawale added.

259.title: Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra do part-time politics: Rathore
259.article_body: Condemning Rahul Gandhi over his viral video, BJP MP Rajyavardhan Rathore said Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra do part-time politics. Calling the Congress government in Rajasthan "useless", Rathore questioned why the Congress government was not working on its responsibilities. Rathore's comment came after Congress MP Rahul Gandhi was seen in a viral video at a nightclub in Kathmandu.

260.title: What is the big deal: Sanjay Raut on case against Raj Thackeray
260.article_body: Reacting to the case filed against MNS chief Raj Thackeray, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said, "What was the big deal about it?" He said similar cases were filed against people who have made instigating speeches. Sanjay Raut added that people from outside Maharashtra were being brought and a conspiracy for rioting was being hatched.

261.title: India needs stable Centre which PM is already providing: Amarinder
261.article_body: Former Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh on Tuesday said that India needs a stable and strong government for 2024, which PM Narendra Modi is already providing. He further said that while the people of Punjab voted for AAP, the party has already "backed out on several promises and commitments". Punjabis will never tolerate an outsider like Arvind Kejriwal, he said.

262.title: Bairstow's best has come as an opener, PBKS must play him there: Dasgupta
262.article_body: Deep Dasgupta said Jonny Bairstow's best T20 knocks have come when he has opened the innings, adding PBKS must play him in the opening slot with Shikhar Dhawan and Mayank Agarwal should bat at number three. "In the last season, he opened as well. He's in good form," he added. Bairstow scored one run against GT in IPL on Tuesday.

263.title: Google fires another AI scientist who challenged its findings: NYT
263.article_body: Google fired AI scientist Satrajit Chatterjee in March after he reportedly challenged a paper by the company, which had claimed that computers could design some chip components better than humans. As per New York Times, Google confirmed that Chatterjee was "terminated with cause" but declined to elaborate. Earlier, it fired two other AI team members, Timnit Gebru and Margaret Mitchell.

264.title: My arrest by Assam Police a pre-planned conspiracy: MLA Mevani
264.article_body: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani has said that his arrest by Assam Police was a "pre-planned conspiracy" at the "behest of their political bosses in Delhi". Mevani said that he was in jail for nine days but didn't complain, adding that the FIR against him was frivolous. He further warned of a Gujarat bandh on June 1.

265.title: UK donates 13 armoured vehicles to evacuate civilians from Ukraine
265.article_body: UK is sending 13 armoured vehicles to help evacuate civilians from besieged areas of eastern Ukraine, the government said on Tuesday. The steel-plated vehicles, which are bulletproof and can resist explosive devices and anti-personnel mines, will also be used to transport Ukrainian officials to their temporary command posts, UK said. The donation comes in response to a request from Ukraine.

266.title: Did Fadnavis become 'Mr India' & demolish Babri's dome?: Shiv Sena
266.article_body: Shiv Sena on Tuesday asked if BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis demolished Babri Masjid after becoming "Mr India". Responding to Fadnavis' claims that he was present "to bring [Babri Masjid] down", Shiv Sena said, "Shouldn’t history record that Fadnavis broke through the rising sea of Hindus and climbed Babri’s dome and continued to strike with hammers? This is amazing."

267.title: Indian student enrolled in Pak university, father chargesheeted for terror activities
267.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police has filed a chargesheet against three persons, including an Indian student enrolled in a Pakistani university and his father, for indulging in terror activities. The accused also allegedly passed information across the border about Army units. Officials said this was another example of Pakistan misusing higher studies as bait for recruitment in terror groups.

268.title: Looks like 'ax the itch': Musk on pic of US politician in 'Tax the Rich' Met Gala 2021 dress
268.article_body: Elon Musk on Tuesday took a dig at US politician Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez by tweeting, "Can only read one side. Looks like "ax the itch"?" on Met Gala 2021 picture. She wore an off-white dress with a 'Tax the Rich' message. A few days ago, Musk asked Alexandria to "stop hitting" on him over her "billionaire with an ego problem" tweet.

269.title: BJP working to take India forward as a great power: JP Nadda
269.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Tuesday said that the party was working under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi to take India forward as a great power. Speaking on the occasion of the inauguration of South Delhi district BJP office in Okhla, he added that over 200 of the 512 offices being built across the country had been completed.

270.title: Woman declared dead knocks on coffin to say she's alive during her funeral in Peru
270.article_body: A woman who was declared dead after a car crash in Peru knocked from inside her coffin during her funeral to tell people she was alive. "[She] opened her eyes and was sweating. I immediately went to my office and called the police," cemetery caretaker said. She was reportedly put on life-support by doctors, but she died few hours later.

271.title: Nicholas Pooran appointed West Indies white-ball captain
271.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Nicholas Pooran has been appointed the captain of West Indies' ODI and T20I teams. This comes after Kieron Pollard announced his retirement from international cricket in April. "To be named captain is indeed the highlight of my career...I want to drive the team forward to accomplish great things," Pooran said.

272.title: Was on medication during viral Faiz & Ghalib interview: Saif Ali Khan
272.article_body: Saif Ali Khan, speaking about his old interview on Faiz and Ghalib, has said, "I think I'm on medication (in the interview). Let's call it medication." Saif added he's proud of that interview. In the viral interview, Saif had said Faiz and Ghalib are his favourite poets but later added, "I'm talking rubbish...Is this the age to reach such things?"

273.title: Aimed to play for India when MSD hit winning 6 in WC 2011 final: CSK's Mukesh
273.article_body: Revealing what made him decide that he'd like to play for India someday, CSK pacer Mukesh Choudhary said it was when MS Dhoni hit the match-winning six in 2011 World Cup final. "I used to play cricket but...began taking the game more seriously after that historic moment," he added. Mukesh has taken 11 wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

274.title: Small, big parties should unite to oust BJP from Centre: AK Antony
274.article_body: Congress leader AK Antony on Tuesday said that all small and big parties need to unite and come on a common platform in order to remove the BJP from the Centre. He said that Congress should take the lead in this, however, 'some' people believe it can be done without them. "What can be said to such people," he added.

275.title: Urge people to contribute to relief material for Sri Lanka: TN CM
275.article_body: Amid the economic crisis in Sri Lanka, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin urged people to contribute to the humanitarian relief material to be sent to Sri Lanka. MK Stalin thanked External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar for accepting Tamil Nadu's request on supplementing India's humanitarian aid to the country. Earlier, Tamil Nadu sought permission to supply essentials to Sri Lanka.

276.title: Chicken song is the most political song in 'Bajrangi...': Kabir Khan
276.article_body: Kabir Khan has said that the song 'Chicken Kuk-Doo-Koo' is the most political song of his film 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' because it came in the face of the beef ban. He added 'Chaudhary Dhaba' in the song is a metaphor for India. "Half dhaba is non-veg, half is veg. You decide what you want...[we] can sit together and eat," he said.

277.title: Body scrub is 1 thing that helped my anxiety: Aamir Khan's daughter
277.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan wrote on Instagram that body scrub is the one thing that helped her anxiety. She added that "it made for a heightened tactile...experience". Ira further wrote that she is "caught up" in her own head "too much" and "increasing the number of tactile experiences" in her daily life "may be a good idea".

278.title: Facebook to shut down podcast service after a year on June 3
278.article_body: Facebook is shutting down its podcast service and will remove them altogether from its platform on June 3, Bloomberg reported citing a company note. Users won't be allowed to add podcasts starting this week while the Live Audio Rooms will reportedly be integrated into Facebook Live. Facebook had launched these in June 2021 in competition to Clubhouse live audio app.

279.title: Video shows PM Modi playing dhol in Denmark's Copenhagen
279.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi played dhol as he reached the venue to meet the Indian community on his visit to Denmark's Copenhagen on Tuesday. A video shows Indians dressed in traditional attire dancing near the venue. On Monday, PM Modi played the drums when he arrived at the Potsdamer Platz in Germany's Berlin to address the Indian diaspora.

280.title: Inclusiveness, cultural diversity strength of Indian community: PM in Denmark
280.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while addressing Indian nationals in Copenhagen during his visit to Denmark on Tuesday, said that "inclusiveness and cultural diversity" is the strength of the Indian community. "Whatever the language, our culture is Indian. We believe in 'Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam' – one world," he added. "We stand together for the defence of the nation," the PM further said.

281.title: We should use cinema as soft power, win hearts of future generations: Shekhar
281.article_body: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur stated that if India has to use cinema as a soft power, we have to win the minds and hearts of future generations around the world. He further said that our stories should be told through popular media like gaming using the latest technology. "I'd like to see games featuring Indian characters in Indian costumes," Shekhar added.

282.title: Rumours over leadership change hypothetical: K'taka BJP in-charge
282.article_body: BJP national General Secretary in-charge of Karnataka Arun Singh called rumours of possible leadership changes in Karnataka hypothetical. He said CM Basavaraj Bommai is a common man and people liked him. He added that cabinet expansion or reshuffle was the prerogative of the CM. BJP's Karnataka President Nalin Kumar Kateel also said there was no confusion regarding party leadership.

283.title: 3,000 people flee armed clashes in northern Iraq
283.article_body: At least 3,000 people fled Iraq's Sinjar and its surrounding areas after clashes broke out between the Iraqi army and local fighters linked to a Kurdish separatist group. They headed farther north towards the semi-autonomous Kurdish region to seek asylum. An Iraqi soldier was killed and two others were injured in the clashes, an army officer and an MP said.

284.title: UP CM Yogi Adityanath meets mother after several years in native village, shares pic
284.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, who is currently in his native village Panchur in Pauri Garhwal district of Uttarakhand, met his mother after several years and shared a photo on Twitter. Captioned 'Ma', the photo shows him touching her feet. He also paid a visit to the teachers of his school.

285.title: 1,50,000 Ukrainians using Starlink internet service daily: Govt
285.article_body: About 1,50,000 people in Ukraine are using SpaceX's Starlink internet service each day, Ukraine Digital Minister Mykhailo Fedorov tweeted. He added, "This is crucial support for...restoring the destroyed territories. Ukraine will stay connected no matter what." This comes after SpaceX CEO Elon Musk activated Starlink service in Ukraine in February following Fedorov's request amid war with Russia.

286.title: Russian forces launch attack on besieged Mariupol steel plant
286.article_body: Russian forces on Tuesday launched an attack on a steel plant in Mariupol, Ukrainian forces defending it said. "We'll do everything that's possible to repel the assault, but we're calling for urgent measures to evacuate the civilians that remain inside the plant," a Ukrainian military official said. About 200 civilians are estimated to be trapped in the plant.

287.title: Jain University tops Khelo India University Games, Amit Shah presents trophy
287.article_body: Jain University has topped the Khelo India University Games 2021 in Bengaluru, ending with 20 gold, seven silver and five bronze medals. Chief guest at closing ceremony Union Home Minister Amit Shah presented the trophy and congratulated all the universities and athletes who participated in the event. Lovely Professional University and Panjab University stood second and third respectively.

288.title: Concerned for son Ibrahim's future, I'm full of nervous prayer: Saif
288.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan said he's concerned for his son Ibrahim Ali Khan's future. "He has done well in school and like any parent, I'm full of nervous prayer that his future goes well," he added. Ibrahim is currently assisting filmmaker Karan Johar in 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. "I am happy he is working hard," Saif stated.

289.title: There should be mutual respect: Nitish Kumar on loudspeaker issue
289.article_body: Commenting on the loudspeaker issue, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar said that there should be mutual respect for each other in the country irrespective of their religion. After attending a prayer on the occasion of Eid, Nitish Kumar said, "There are people who have a certain belief and they act accordingly and this should be respected."

290.title: UP CM Yogi unveils statue of his spiritual guru in Uttarakhand
290.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath unveiled the statue of his spiritual guru Brahmalin Mahant Avaidyanath at the Guru Gorakhnath Mahavidyalaya premises in Uttarkhand's Yamkeshwar on Tuesday. Addressing a function, CM Yogi said he had attended a school in Chamkotkhal near Yamkeshwar from class 1 to 9 and that he was grateful to get the opportunity to honour his school teachers.

291.title: West should use its influence to stop Ukraine war crimes: Putin to Macron
291.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin told his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron in a telephonic conversation on Tuesday that the West should use its influence to halt atrocities in Ukraine. Putin said that West could stop supplying arms to Ukraine and help stop "war crimes (and) massive shelling of towns...in Donbas". Russia has denied war crimes by its forces in the country.

292.title: The constant bullying, trolling makes me go crazy: Urfi Javed
292.article_body: 'Bigg Boss OTT' fame Urfi Javed has reacted to "the constant bullying [and] trolling" she faces saying that it makes her go crazy sometimes. She wrote in a now-deleted Instagram story that "the hate...abuses...trolls...rape threats...death threats" get her at times. "Usually I'm ok but today is a very rare day where I feel like giving up," Urfi wrote.

293.title: Shah Rukh Khan greets fans from Mannat on Eid after 2 yrs, shares pics
293.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan greeted his fans from his residence Mannat's balcony after a gap of two years on the occasion of Eid. Taking to Twitter, he shared pictures of him greeting his fans and wrote, "How lovely to meet you all on Eid...Eid Mubarak!!" He did not greet fans for the past two years due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

294.title: Always take your people with you: Anil Agarwal on secret to success
294.article_body: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal on Monday shared what he believes is the secret to his success. "I often get asked, 'How did you do it?' The answer is very simple. No matter how far you get in life, you must always take your people with you," Agarwal wrote. "You must empower your people to deliver their best," he added.

295.title: Video shows 18-yr-old Indian-origin UK man crashing stolen Range Rover into Mercedes van
295.article_body: UK's Metropolitan Police has released a video showing the moment an 18-year-old Indian-origin man crashed a stolen Range Rover car into a Mercedes van last year. "This is the moment a dangerous driver drove the wrong way through the Blackwall Tunnel. 18-year-old Johal Rathour has been jailed," it tweeted. He has been jailed for four years.

296.title: Inspire at least 5 friends to visit India: PM to Indian diaspora in Denmark
296.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday interacted with the Indian community in Copenhagen, Denmark and asked them to inspire others to visit India. "You should inspire at least five of your friends to visit India...and people will say 'Chalo India'," he said. PM Modi further said, "This is the work you all 'Rashtradoot' have to do."

297.title: 10 killed, 11 injured in jeep-auto collision in UP's Kasganj
297.article_body: Ten people, including two children and seven women, were killed after their autorickshaw collided head-on with a speeding jeep in UP's Kasganj district on Tuesday. The jeep driver had allegedly fallen asleep while driving, leading to the crash, according to the investigation by police. 11 people travelling in the jeep were also injured and were admitted to hospital, police said.

298.title: Cambodia's PM calls for access to Myanmar's ousted leader Suu Kyi
298.article_body: Cambodia's PM Hun Sen has urged Myanmar's junta chief Min Aung Hlaing to allow a special envoy from ASEAN access to ousted leader Aung San Suu Kyi. Sen, the current Chairman of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), made the request during a video call on Monday. Min Aung Hlaing had led a coup against Suu Kyi last year.

299.title: Rocket Lab catches rocket booster returning from space using a helicopter
299.article_body: US-based space company Rocket Lab captured its rocket booster returning from space using a helicopter for a test. "The mid-air capture is a major milestone in our pursuit to make a reusable rocket to increase launch frequency," the company said. Rocket Lab used a combination of ropes, parachutes, a heat shield and a helicopter with two pilots for the test.

300.title: Loudspeaker row created to divert focus from Centre's failures: Ex-MP CM
300.article_body: Ex-MP CM Digvijaya Singh said on Tuesday that the ongoing loudspeaker controversy has been created to deflect focus from Centre's failures. "All these are useless talks...People’s attention is being diverted from issues like...inflation and unemployment," he added. MNS leader Raj Thackeray had said that Hanuman Chalisa will be played outside mosques if loudspeakers there aren't removed by May 3.

301.title: Childless UP woman hires gang for ₹20,000 to abduct 2-yr-old boy, arrested
301.article_body: A woman, desperate for a child after losing her toddler due to illness, hired a gang for ₹20,000 to abduct a two-year-old boy so she could raise him as her son in Uttar Pradesh. Four, including two women and a teenager, have been arrested. The boy was abducted from a railway station's platform, where he was sleeping near his father.

302.title: 'Sacred Games' raised the bar for Indian content: Shweta Tripathi
302.article_body: Actress Shweta Tripathi has said Nawazuddin Siddiqui-starrer 'Sacred Games' raised the bar for Indian content. "Before that, there was a level of content being churned out," she stated. "The show made way for everyone to make the best of content," she added. Shweta said she's currently reading the script of 'Mirzapur 3' and added it is better than previous seasons.

303.title: Porn clip plays on projector during Union Minister's event in Assam; probe launched
303.article_body: An investigation has been launched after a pornographic clip was allegedly played on a projector during a recent event attended by Union Minister Rameswar Teli and Assam Minister Sanjoy Kishan. The incident took place during the pilot rollout of methanol-blended M-15 petrol in Assam's Tinsukia by Indian Oil. Police have reportedly detained a projector operator in connection with the incident.

304.title: Pilots' federation reject claim of Runway 34 being based on true events
304.article_body: Federation of Indian Pilots Secretary Captain CS Randhawa stated airline pilots are "unrealistically portrayed" in Ajay Devgn's 'Runway 34', adding it may create apprehensions in the minds of fliers. The statement said the film's story shouldn't be perceived as a true depiction of pilots' professionalism. It added industry has a zero-tolerance policy towards deviant behaviour and substance abuse.

305.title: 'Get out!' TV anchor tells Telugu actor Vishwak Sen during debate over 'suicide prank'
305.article_body: A video shows a news anchor shouting at Telugu actor Vishwak Sen during a debate on his 'suicide prank' video. Sen is heard saying, "You better mind your tongue and not call me...depressed person" after which the anchor says, "You can get out of my studio." Vishwak took part in the prank video as part of promotions for his film.

306.title: 'RRR' is truly a treat for all senses, world class cinema: Anil Kapoor
306.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor on Monday took to Twitter to appreciate filmmaker SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' calling it "one of the most entertaining and phenomenal films of recent times." He further wrote, "Truly a treat for all senses! World class cinema!" Anil went to watch the film with veteran actor Anupam Kher at a theatre and said it felt like a date.

307.title: Sri Lankan govt to provide cash to low income families amid crisis
307.article_body: Low income Sri Lankan families "severely affected" by the country's current economic crisis will receive a cash allowance from the government. Cash allowances ranging from LKR 3,000 to LKR 7,500 will be provided to such families. The move is expected to benefit about 33 lakh families from May to July, according to Trade Minister Shehan Semasinghe.

308.title: Salman Khan greets fans from balcony on Eid after 3 yrs, shares pics
308.article_body: Actor Salman Khan on Tuesday greeted and waved at his fans from the balcony of his house in Bandra's Galaxy Apartments after a gap of three years due to the pandemic. He also shared pictures of greeting the crowd on social media. Salman's Eid bash will reportedly be hosted at his sister Arpita Khan and her husband Aayush Sharma's residence.

309.title: Char Dham yatra begins as Gangotri-Yamunotri portals opens for devotees
309.article_body: The Char Dham yatra began on Tuesday as the portals of Gangotri and Yamunotri temples in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi were opened for devotees. CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, along with his wife, visited Gangotri to offer prayers and witness the ceremonious opening of the temple gates. The daily limit on the number of pilgrims for Gangotri is 7,000 and 4,000 for Yamunotri.

310.title: He's like a trigger, bang: Ferdinand picks Diaz as his PL signing of season
310.article_body: Picking Liverpool winger Luis Fernando Diaz as his Premier League signing of the season, ex-Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said, "He's like a trigger, bang, go, go and get it back." He added, "You watch him play, on the ball he's brilliant...but his reaction when they lose the ball is unreal." The 25-year-old was signed by Liverpool in January.

311.title: Manika jumps 10 spots for career-best world no. 38, Sathiyan becomes no. 34
311.article_body: Paddler Manika Batra has jumped 10 spots to attain a career-high ranking of 38 in women's singles, while Sathiyan Gnanasekaran was the best placed Indian at 34 in men's side in latest International Table Tennis Federation (ITTF) rankings. Meanwhile, Sharath Kamal gained one place to be number 37. In men's doubles, Sathiyan and Harmeet Desai are ranked 29th.

312.title: Indian community chants 'Modi, Modi' as PM meets them in Denmark, video surfaces
312.article_body: A video shared by the Prime Minister's Office shows PM Narendra Modi and Danish PM Mette Frederiksen meeting the Indian community after a meeting with business leaders in Copenhagen, Denmark. In the video, the people can be seen carrying the Indian national flag and chanting 'Modi, Modi'. PM Modi and his Danish counterpart greeted the crowd.

313.title: Cumin prices set to rise 30-35% to touch five-year high: Report
313.article_body: An estimated 35% decline in production in crop season 2021-22 that started in November is set to drive up cumin prices to a five-year high, ratings agency Crisil reported. As per its report, cumin prices are likely to rise up to 30-35% to reach ₹165-170 per kg. It further stated that cumin acreage this season fell by 21% year-on-year.

314.title: SII's Covovax now available for children in India: Poonawalla
314.article_body: SII's COVID-19 vaccine Covovax is now available for children, CEO Adar Poonawalla said on Tuesday. A dose of Covovax for children aged 12-17 will cost ₹900, in addition to hospital service charge of ₹150, PTI reported. "This is the only vaccine manufactured in India that is also sold in Europe and has an efficacy of over 90%," Poonawalla added.

315.title: Aurobindo Pharma gets USFDA nod for generic cancer treatment drug
315.article_body: Hyderabad-based Aurobindo Pharma said its wholly-owned arm Eugia Pharma Specialties Ltd has received approval from the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) for its generic Bortezomib drug. It is used to treat adult patients with multiple myeloma and mantle cell lymphoma. The approved product has a market size of $1.172 billion for the year ended March 2022, the company said.

316.title: National-level hockey player's hut demolished in anti-encroachment drive in MP
316.article_body: A hut belonging to 18-year-old national-level hockey player Sagu Dawar and her family was demolished during an anti-encroachment drive conducted by police and Mandsaur administration in Madhya Pradesh. Dawar claimed she and her family had asked the administration for two-three days' time to vacate the land, but police went ahead with the demolition before they could leave with their belongings.

317.title: China's Zhengzhou imposes COVID-related movement curbs from May 4-10
317.article_body: China's Zhengzhou city on Tuesday announced that it would impose coronavirus-related curbs on movements from May 4 to 10. Schools in the main city district will go online, while employees of government organisations and companies must work from home during that period, an official statement said. The new measures would be subject to adjustment after May 10, it added.

318.title: Heard hires new crisis management firm amid defamation trial
318.article_body: Amber Heard has hired a new crisis management firm amid the ongoing defamation suit filed against her by ex-husband Johnny Depp. New York Post stated her new team earlier worked against Depp in a case by his former business managers. They had alleged that Depp needed to hire a shrink for his "compulsive spending" habit of $2 million per month.

319.title: President Kovind arrives in Assam for 4-day Northeast tour
319.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind arrived in Assam's Guwahati on Tuesday for a four-day Northeast tour. He was received at the Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport by CM Himanta Biswa Sarma and Governor Jagdish Mukhi. He'll be addressing the 61st annual conference of Bodo Sahitya Sabha in Tamulpur on Wednesday and will also attend North East Festival's valedictory function in Guwahati.

320.title: Will protest in Jodhpur if no action taken on clashes: Union Minister
320.article_body: Reacting to recent Jodhpur violence, Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Tuesday said that the law and order situation in Rajasthan is in disarray. Shekhawat added that he will hold a "massive protest" at city's Jalori Gate if no action is taken on the incident. Clashes broke out between two communities in the city after Eid prayers on Monday night.

321.title: Congress shares pic of BJP's Javadekar popping champagne at party
321.article_body: Congress leader Srinivas BV has shared a picture of Rajya Sabha MP Prakash Javadekar popping a champagne bottle at a party. "Pehchan kaun?" Srinivas BV captioned the picture. This comes after a video went viral showing Congress leader Rahul Gandhi at a nightclub in Kathmandu. Congress said Rahul went to Nepal to attend the wedding of a friend.

322.title: Taught him to walk, he trampled us: Shivpal amid reports of rift with Akhilesh
322.article_body: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia chief Shivpal Yadav, in an apparent reference to his nephew and Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav, on Tuesday said he compromised on self-respect to "satisfy" him, but was still hurt. Taking to Twitter, he added, "We taught him how to walk and he went on trampling us." His remarks came amid reports of a rift with Akhilesh.

323.title: Scheme to provide meals to BEST staffers in Mumbai launched
323.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aditya Thackeray launched a scheme along with Akshaya Chaitanya, an NGO, to provide meals to Brihanmumbai Electric Supply & Transport Undertaking (BEST) staffers in Mumbai. He added that they also intend to provide free meals to around 6,000 to 7,000 people including students of municipal schools and families in government hospitals.

324.title: Want to meet Putin in Moscow, discuss Ukraine's invasion: Pope
324.article_body: Pope Francis said on Tuesday that he'd requested to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow to discuss Ukraine's invasion but hadn't received a response from Russia. Pope added that while he's still keen on meeting Putin, the latter perhaps "does not want to have this meeting". Notably, Pope has denounced ongoing war and appealed for peace on multiple occasions.

325.title: 19 crore doses of COVID vaccines available with states, UTs: Govt
325.article_body: The Union Health Ministry on Tuesday said that states and Union Territories (UTs) have more than 19.01 crore balance and unutilised doses of COVID-19 vaccines. Separately, over 193.53 crore doses of vaccines have been provided to states and UTs so far, it added. The government is committed to accelerating the pace of COVID-19 vaccination throughout the country, it further said.

326.title: 2 booked under NSA by police after brawl in pub in MP's Indore
326.article_body: Police in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Tuesday booked two persons under the National Security Act (NSA) in connection with a brawl that broke out in Four More Shots pub recently. It is believed one of the accused is the manager of the pub. At least 12 people have been arrested so far in connection with the incident.

327.title: Porters at MP's Bhopal railway station to get AC restrooms
327.article_body: Air-conditioned restrooms for porters are being planned at MP's Bhopal railway station. Minister of Medical Education Vishvas Sarang said that the retiring rooms will be constructed on the side of platform number one. Sarang also informed that a two-lane railway overbridge will be built from Chola Mandir to platform number one of the main railway station to facilitate people's movement.

328.title: 2 tribal men accused of cow slaughter beaten to death in MP, another injured
328.article_body: Two tribal men were beaten to death by a group of 15-20 people over suspicion of cow slaughter in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district. Another person was left injured by the attackers in the incident. "We have taken two-three suspects into custody. Some 12 kilograms of meat have been found at the victims' house," Seoni Additional Superintendent of Police said.

329.title: Neither I can confirm nor deny: Ashneer on alleged old audio of abusing bank employee
329.article_body: BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover at a recent event said, "Neither I can confirm nor deny it," when he was asked about the old audio clip of him allegedly verbally abusing a Kotak employee. "This is a bitter question," Grover said on the question about the audio. Earlier, reports said Grover abused the employee over missing share allocation in Nykaa's IPO.

330.title: PM Modi mentions the term 'FOMO' while talking about those not investing in India
330.article_body: While addressing a business forum in Denmark's Copenhagen on Tuesday, PM Narendra Modi said that the term 'FOMO' (fear of missing out) is gaining traction on social media these days. "Looking at India's reforms and investment opportunities, I can say that those who don't invest in our nation will certainly miss out," he added.

331.title: GST on online gaming may be raised from 18% to 28%: Reports
331.article_body: The Group of Ministers has recommended casinos, racecourses and online gaming shall be taxed under the 28% GST slab, reports said on Tuesday. Currently, online gaming is taxed at 18% of the platform fee, which works out to 5-20% of the contest entry amount. Chance gaming like racing, betting and lotteries are taxed at 28% of the contest entry amount.

332.title: BCCI announce schedule for IPL 2022 playoffs
332.article_body: IPL 2022 playoffs and final will be played from May 24 to May 29 in Kolkata and Ahmedabad, the BCCI have announced. Qualifier 1 will be held at Eden Gardens in Kolkata on May 24, followed by Eliminator on May 25. Ahmedabad's Narendra Modi Stadium will host Qualifier 2 and IPL 2022 final on May 27 and May 29, respectively.

333.title: NASA shares video that simulates a black hole, people compare it with 'Interstellar'
333.article_body: NASA's Instagram page shared a visualisation simulating appearance of a black hole as seen on its edge, where inbound matter has collected into a thin, hot structure called an accretion disk. Referring to the 2014 film 'Interstellar', an Instagram user commented, "Reminds me of the black hole in Interstellar." "You can tell Interstellar production worked with scientists," another person commented.

334.title: Parents don't pay for my s**t, it's sad reality: Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor
334.article_body: Actor Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor has said, "My parents have no interest in paying for my s**t...I'd have had ten times more than what I have but I buy my...stuff." "It's the sad reality of my life," he added. Harsh said he is looking to buy a pre-owned Lamborghini for ₹1 crore instead of buying a new model for ₹3 crore.

335.title: Why is removing loudspeakers a problem in Delhi: BJP's Adesh Gupta
335.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta condemned the Aam Aadmi Party-led government in Delhi, questioning why removing loudspeakers from religious institutes in Delhi was a problem when there are no loudspeakers in mosques of Muslim countries either. The BJP Delhi unit wrote a letter to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal saying noise pollution level had reached its extreme in Delhi.

336.title: Knock against Cottrell in IPL 2020 gave Tewatia confidence: Gavaskar
336.article_body: Talking about batter Rahul Tewatia, who has been helping GT finish off run-chases on a regular basis in ongoing IPL, Sunil Gavaskar said the assault on Sheldon Cottrell in IPL 2020 gave him confidence that he belongs to this level. Tewatia hit five sixes in 18th over bowled by Cottrell to help his then team RR win by four wickets.

337.title: Lion mauls 5-year-old girl to death in Gujarat's Amreli
337.article_body: Forest officials said that a five-year-old girl was mauled to death by a lion in Gujarat's Amreli, after which the lion was caught and taken to an animal care centre. The victim was the daughter of a farm labourer from Rajasthan. She was playing in the village when the lion attacked her and dragged her, the officials added.

338.title: BJP sent demolition notice to 4 Delhi temples to extort money: Atishi
338.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's Atishi on Tuesday alleged that the BJP-led Central government posted demolition notices on the walls of four temples in Delhi in order to extort money. She said that the BJP government had issued the order to demolish the Neelkanth Mahadev temple in Sriniwaspuri and a similar order has now been issued against four temples of Sarojini Nagar.

339.title: Stash of arms, ammunition including AK-56 recovered from Arunachal
339.article_body: A huge cache of arms, ammunition and explosives were recovered by the Indian army from Arunachal Pradesh's Changlang district on Tuesday. Police said that 14 Rajput Regiment recovered the arms and ammunition from the forest area of Phinbiro-I, suspected to be hidden by a proscribed outfit. One AK-56 rifle, two SBML guns were among the recovered ammunition.

340.title: Thieves steal jewellery, cash worth ₹1.5 lakh from parked car in MP
340.article_body: A bag containing jewellery and cash worth about ₹1.5 lakh was stolen from a car in MP's Ujjain on Monday. The owner had parked his car outside the premises of a building where he had gone to attend a wedding ceremony. A family member found the window broken and valuables missing after she returned to the car around 3 pm.

341.title: Jared Leto & Gucci's Alessandro Michele twin at Met Gala 2022
341.article_body: Actor Jared Leto twinned with Gucci designer Alessandro Michele at the Met Gala 2022. The duo donned the same tuxedos, clutches, hair clips and sunglasses while posing for cameras together at the event. Leto and Michele also wore the same red bow ties, black gloves and shoes. Last year, Leto carried a replica of his head at the Met Gala.

342.title: Table-toppers GT to bat first against PBKS, both teams unchanged
342.article_body: Table-toppers Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bat first against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. Both the teams are playing with unchanged playing XIs. GT have won five matches in a row, while PBKS are currently eighth on the points table with four wins from nine matches.

343.title: My free speech banned over Kashmir Files, I'm victim of hate campaign: Vivek
343.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has shared a video on Twitter claiming that he is a "victim of a hate campaign" and his "free speech was banned" over 'The Kashmir Files'. He said that a group of foreign journalists had invited him to address a press conference but it was cancelled after some members of "powerful media" took "strong objection" to it.

344.title: Won't celebrate Eid this year, my mom is in ICU: Zareen Khan
344.article_body: Actress Zareen Khan has stated that she will not celebrate Eid this year since her mother is in the ICU. Zareen added it will be Eid for her when her mother returns home. "I used to eagerly wait for Eid as a child...It was a huge thing to receive ₹100 (as Eidi) and I'd always save the money," she said.

345.title: Madras HC summons Dhanush after couple claims he is their son
345.article_body: Actor Dhanush has been summoned by the Madras High Court after a couple moved the court claiming that he is their son. Kathiseran and his wife Meenakshi have claimed that Dhanush had submitted forged documents of paternity test. Their case was earlier dismissed in 2020 saying that there were no supporting documents to prove that the paternity documents were forged.

346.title: Will support Sweden & Finland if they apply to join NATO: Germany
346.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said on Tuesday that the country will back Finland and Sweden's potential bid for NATO membership, adding that no one can assume Russia won't attack other countries. "[Putin] wants to expand his territory...push borders with violence," he added. Scholz's remarks come amid reports that Sweden and Finland are likely to apply for NATO membership in May.

347.title: Man tries to set police chowky on fire in Mumbai's Mira Road; arrested
347.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested for trying to burn down a police chowky in the Shanti Park area of Mumbai's Mira Road. The accused, Sunny Sadanand Kadam, used petrol from the fuel tank of one of the patrolling bikes to set the chowky on fire. Passers-by not only doused the fire but also caught Kadam on the spot.

348.title: Actor Oscar Isaac wears a dress at Met Gala, his wife Elvira wears a suit; fans react
348.article_body: Marvel's Moon Knight actor Oscar Isaac attended the Met Gala wearing a white tie and tails tailored dress, while his filmmaker-wife Elvira Lind wore a suit. Both of them wore outfits designed by Thom Browne. "Looking super stylish...love seeing men in skirts," an Instagram user commented. "Well played, they both look stunning," another comment read

349.title: Mumbai Police seizes loudspeakers from MNS office, detains Chandivali party unit chief
349.article_body: Mumbai Police on Tuesday seized loudspeakers from the office of Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) in Chandivali and detained party's unit chief Mahendra Bhanushali, among other leaders. Police have also issued notices to at least 100 people. The move comes after Thackeray asked people to play Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques from May 4 if loudspeakers there were not removed.

350.title: Shivaji memorial at Raigad Fort wasn't built by Lokmanya Tilak: Sambhaji
350.article_body: BJP MP Sambhaji Chhatrapati has reacted to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's statement that Lokmanya Tilak built Chhatrapati Shivaji's memorial at Raigad Fort near Pune. "I can state with some authority that Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's memorial was not built by Lokmanya Tilak," he said.
