Sambhaji is a descendant of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and the great-grandson of Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj.

351.title: 4 men arrested for ATM card cloning in Mumbai
351.article_body: At least four men were arrested by the Mira-Bhayandar, Vasai-Virar (MBVV) police for cloning ATM cards and withdrawing money. Acting on secret information, the police arrested Saurabh Yadav, who informed them about his three aides, leading to their arrest. Three laptops, four ATM card cloners, eight ATM card skimming devices and five mobile phones were recovered from the accused.

352.title: Delhi Police arrests 114, recover 4.6 kg of drugs in last 24 hrs
352.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 114 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and recovered 4.6 kilograms of narcotics substances in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 12 proclaimed offenders, seized 174 quarters of illicit liquor and recovered 19 stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 5,422 calls, the post added.

353.title: People in Delhi used to taunt us saying 'Sachin and his parents are going': Sanju Samson
353.article_body: Cricketer Sanju Samson recalled how his parents used to face taunts during his earlier days in Delhi. "Our parents used to carry...our kit bags as [me and my brother] were very young. People would remark 'Sachin and his parents are going...He'll become Tendulkar'," he said. Samson added, "A lot of fun was made at them like this...but they were confident."

354.title: DC's 22-year-old opener Prithvi Shaw buys apartment in Mumbai for ₹10.5 crore: Report
354.article_body: DC opener Prithvi Shaw has bought a flat in Mumbai's Bandra West for ₹10.5 crore, Moneycontrol reported. The unit with a 2,209-sq ft carpet area and a terrace of 1,654-sq ft was registered on April 28, the report added. The 22-year-old cricketer, who has scored 259 runs in IPL 2022 so far, was retained by DC for ₹7.5 crore.

355.title: Denmark PM gives PM Modi tour of her house, pics show painting he gifted her last year
355.article_body: After receiving PM Narendra Modi at the Copenhagen airport on Tuesday, Danish PM Mette Frederiksen gave him a tour of her official residence. She also showed the Pattachitra painting from Odisha gifted by PM Modi during her visit to India last year. Both the Prime Ministers also addressed a joint press meet.

356.title: Maratha Mandir executive director refuses to screen 'Doctor Strange 2'
356.article_body: G7 multiplex and Maratha Mandir Cinema's executive director, Manoj Desai, refused to screen 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. He stated the booker of their cinema had said the film will be given to them if they increase the ticket fee by ₹30. "Managing director of our cinema isn't in favour of increasing rates by even ₹1," he added.

357.title: MNS bagged a contract from BJP to disturb peace in Maha: Sanjay Raut
357.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that Maharashtra Navnirman Sena bagged a contract from BJP to disturb peace in Maharashtra. "The government must find out the political party that has given the contract to the 'Hindu Owaisi' to disturb the peace and harmony in the state. The government is standing on solid footing," Raut said.

358.title: 24 Rohingyas, including 10 children, held in Tripura
358.article_body: The Tripura Police on Tuesday said that 24 Rohingya immigrants, including 10 children, were detained in the state's Unakoti district on Monday. The BSF had intercepted the migrants in three cars near a checkpoint, they added. The Rohingyas, who had arrived in the state from Jammu, were planning to cross into Bangladesh through the border at Kailashahar, according to sources.

359.title: Hope to swiftly conclude talks on India-EU Free Trade Agreement: PM
359.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said he hopes that negotiations on the India-EU Free Trade Agreement will be concluded swiftly. Speaking at the joint press meet with Danish PM Mette Frederiksen, PM Modi said, "We stressed on the need to ensure a free, open, inclusive and rules-based Indo-Pacific region." We also appealed for a ceasefire in Ukraine, he added.

360.title: Like US & Israel, India now retaliates if someone meddles with our borders: Shah
360.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that like US and Israel, India now retaliates whenever someone meddles with our borders. "Earlier only two nations, the United States of America and Israel, used to retaliate whenever someone meddled with their borders and military. Now due to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, our great nation India has joined that group," he stated.

361.title: Fan asks Kartik why he was in economy not business class, he responds
361.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to Instagram to share a video showing clips of him promoting his upcoming film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. He could be seen sitting in the economy class of an Indigo aircraft on his way to Chandigarh. A fan commented, "Why Kartik Aaryan not travelled in business class?" to which Kartik responded, "Ticket mehengi thi (Ticket was expensive)."

362.title: Ex-Cong MLA Ashwin Kotwal joins BJP ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls
362.article_body: Ahead of the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections, former Congress MLA Ashwin Kotwal joined the BJP on Tuesday. The ex-Khedbrahma MLA tendered his resignation to the Gujarat Legislative Assembly Speaker Nimaben Acharya earlier today. Kotwal, who hails from the tribal community, said that he was "very upset" with Congress, adding that the party "pretends to be within tribal society".

363.title: India's GDP to not reach $5 trillion before FY29: IMF data
363.article_body: India may only become a $5-trillion economy in FY29, data from IMF's World Economic Outlook Database suggested. As per the data, which doesn't go beyond FY28, India's nominal GDP is seen rising to $4.92 trillion in FY28. Earlier this year, Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran had said India would become a $5-trillion economy by FY26 or the following year.

364.title: LIC IPO undervalued, shares being offered at throwaway prices: Cong
364.article_body: Congress General Secretary Randeep Surjewala on Tuesday said the LIC IPO is undervalued and that shares are being offered at throwaway prices. Surjewala also asked why LIC's valuation was reduced from ₹12-14 lakh crore to ₹6 lakh crore in just two months. "Why is government trying to sell LIC when domestic and global financial markets are in turmoil?" Surjewala said.

365.title: If Mohsin keeps working hard, he'll become a very good player: Gambhir
365.article_body: Calling Mohsin Khan a "standout player", LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir said the pacer's "unbelievable" bowling spell of 4-0-16-4 turned the match in their favour against DC in IPL 2022. "If the guy [Mohsin] keeps working hard, he would probably become a very good player," he added. Mohsin was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in LSG's six-run win over DC.

366.title: Tickets in Hyd's 1st class suburban trains to be cheaper by 50% from May 5
366.article_body: A 50% cut in the basic first-class ticket fares has been announced in Hyderabad's suburban MMTS (multi-modal transport system) train network from May 5 (Thursday). The minimum charge for up to 10 km will now be ₹25 as compared to ₹50 earlier. The maximum fare for 36-45 km distance has been reduced to ₹90 from ₹155.

367.title: BJP bulldozing India's secular nature, making mini-Pakistans: Mufti
367.article_body: BJP is "bulldozing the secular nature of the country and in the process making many Pakistans within India", said former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti. "They have failed on all fronts, whether it is employment or inflation, the only thing they are using now is the Hindu-Muslim divide," she said. They have no vision for the county, she added.

368.title: India appealed to take path of dialogues for solution in Ukraine: PM in Denmark
368.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking in Copenhagen, Denmark said India made an appeal to take the path of dialogues and strategy for an immediate ceasefire and solution to the problem in Ukraine. He was speaking at the joint press meet with Danish PM Mette Frederiksen. PM Modi added that over 200 Danish companies are working in different sectors in India.

369.title: Thane police books woman for cheating 12 railway job aspirants of ₹59 lakh
369.article_body: Police in Thane have registered a case against a woman for allegedly cheating 12 people of ₹59 lakh after promising them jobs in the Railways. The woman had given appointment letters to the victims in sealed envelopes. When the job aspirants reported for work at the Central Railway's office, they were told the appointment letters were fake, an officer said.

370.title: I try to push limits to see what I'm capable of: Wrestler Ravi Dahiya
370.article_body: Wrestler Ravi Kumar Dahiya, who became India's first-ever three-time Asian champion, said since he's young (24-year-old), he tries to push the limits to see what he's capable of as he doesn't want to have any regrets later. The Tokyo Olympics silver medallist won his third consecutive gold in 57kg category at 2022 Asian Championships in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, last month.

371.title: 'Jai Bhim' wins Best Film at Dadasaheb Phalke Int'l Film Festival
371.article_body: Actor Suriya's 'Jai Bhim' has won the award for Best Feature Film at the 12th Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival. Actor Manikandan also won the award for Best Supporting Actor for his role in the film. "Thank you @dadasahebfest for the honour," 2D Entertainment tweeted. The film was also sent to the Oscars, however, it did not earn a nomination.

372.title: Merchandise exports rise 24.2% to $38 bn in April, imports grow 26.6%
372.article_body: India's merchandise exports rose 24.22% YoY from $30.75 billion in April 2021 to $38.19 billion in April 2022, Commerce Ministry's preliminary data showed. Imports in April 2022 grew 26.55% YoY to $58.26 billion while trade deficit widened to $20.07 billion against $15.29 billion in April 2021. Petroleum and crude products accounted for 33.5% of imports in April this year.

373.title: Putin has to end the killings, I hope India will influence Russia: Denmark PM
373.article_body: Speaking about Russia-Ukraine war on Tuesday, Danish PM Mette Frederiksen said, "My message is very clear- Putin has to stop this war and end the killings. I hope that India will influence Russia also in this discussion." Frederiksen said this while issuing a statement at a joint press meet with PM Narendra Modi during his first visit to Denmark.

374.title: BJP leading double lives with beer in teapots: Mahua on Rahul's video
374.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra reacted to criticism after Congress' Rahul Gandhi was seen at a nightclub in Nepal. "How on earth is it anybody’s business whether Rahul...or anybody else is in nightclub or at wedding in private time?" she asked. "Sick BJP trolls...should stick to doing what they do best- leading double lives with beer in teapots," she added.

375.title: Special gesture: India as Denmark PM personally comes to receive PM Modi at airport
375.article_body: After Denmark PM Mette Frederiksen personally came to receive PM Narendra Modi at the Copenhagen airport on Tuesday, External Affairs Ministry's Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "Heartwarming to see this special gesture from our Green Partner." It is PM Modi's first visit to Denmark, where he will hold bilateral and multilateral talks.

376.title: Ahead of PM Modi's visit, France's Naval Group backs out of key submarine project
376.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to Paris, France's Naval Group said it's unable to participate in Centre's P-75(I) project, under which 6 conventional submarines are to be domestically built for Indian Navy. "The present Request of Proposal requires that the fuel cell AIP (air independent propulsion)...be sea proven...The French Navy doesn't use such propulsion system," an official stated.

377.title: It's a free country: Musk on potential exodus of Twitter employees
377.article_body: Elon Musk said it's a "free country" after he was asked about a potential exodus of Twitter employees following his takeover on Met Gala's red carpet. "Certainly if anyone doesn't feel comfortable...they'll on their own accord go somewhere else. That's fine," Musk stated. As per Guardian, Twitter workers had raised questions about job security at a recently held company-wide meeting.

378.title: India's richest man's Adani Wilmar buys several brands including 'Kohinoor' rice
378.article_body: India's richest man Gautam Adani's Adani Wilmar announced the acquisition of several brands, including the 'Kohinoor' brand from McCormick Switzerland GMBH. The financial details of the deal were undisclosed. The deal gives Adani Wilmar exclusive rights over the 'Kohinoor' basmati rice brand and 'Ready to Cook', 'Ready to Eat' curries & meals portfolio under the Kohinoor Brand umbrella in India.

379.title: Musk planning to put less of his money into buying Twitter: Report
379.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk, who struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion last month, is "tying up less of his wealth in the deal", Reuters reported. Musk is in talks with large investment firms and high net-worth individuals for the financing. The new financing, if secured, could reduce the $21 billion cash contribution committed by Musk.

380.title: Taiwan reduces quarantine for arrivals amid spike in COVID-19 cases
380.article_body: Taiwan said on Tuesday that it'll reduce mandatory quarantine period from 10 days to seven days for all arrivals from May 9 onwards. Additionally, arriving passengers will have to take an RT-PCR test upon reaching the country. The announcement comes at a time when Taiwan's experiencing a surge in COVID-19 cases with 23,139 new infections reported in last 24 hours.

381.title: Revise timings or advance summer holidays: Parents to Delhi govt
381.article_body: Parents have urged the Delhi government to either revise school hours or advance the summer vacation in view of extreme heat conditions. "During peak summer hours, students are out in the sun, which is really dangerous," said Delhi Parents Association President Aparajita Gautam. Preponing summer vacations isn't an option as schools have opened after a long period, a parent said.

382.title: Railways spent ₹150 cr to repair 2,000 wagons to transport coal
382.article_body: The Indian Railways has spent around ₹150 crore since January to repair over 2,000 wagons to expedite the transportation of coal to power plants, according to officials. An official claimed that the damage was caused by JCBs used by private contractors to unload coal at power plants. Currently, there is a power crisis in the country, leading to blackouts.

383.title: SRK is great: Benedict on his choice for Indian actor in MCU
383.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actor Benedict Cumberbatch, in a recent interview, was asked which Indian actor could play a superhero in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The British actor was given an option between Shah Rukh Khan and Hrithik Roshan. To this, Benedict replied, "[Shah Rukh] Khan is great." Earlier, Benedict spoke about India and said he loves the country and its cultures.

384.title: China sends aircraft carrier, vessels to seas near Japan
384.article_body: Japanese Defence Ministry said that eight Chinese Navy vessels, including an aircraft carrier and destroyers, sailed between Japan's Okinawa island and Miyakojima on Monday. However, the ministry added, there was no incursion into Japan's territorial waters. Reportedly, it is the first time that a Chinese aircraft carrier was confirmed to have passed through the area since December 2021.

385.title: FIR against Raj Thackeray over his speech at Aurangabad rally
385.article_body: A case has been registered against MNS chief Raj Thackeray over his speech at a public rally in Maharashtra's Aurangabad on May 1. The organisers of the rally have also been named in the FIR filed in Aurangabad. In the rally, Thackeray had asked his supporters to play Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques from May 4 if loudspeakers there weren't removed.

386.title: Man Utd would be 15th-16th or even lower in PL without Ronaldo: Ferdinand
386.article_body: Former Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said Manchester United would have been placed on the 15th or 16th position, or even lower in the Premier League this season, in the absence of Cristiano Ronaldo. "I will be absolutely shocked to the hilt if [new manager] Erik ten Hag comes in and says he can't work with Ronaldo," added Ferdinand.

387.title: Taliban tells driving teachers to stop issuing licences to women: Report
387.article_body: Taliban officials in Afghanistan's Herat have verbally instructed driving teachers to stop issuing licences to women, AFP reported. However, we've "not been directed to stop women from driving in the city", Jan Achakzai, head of Herat's Traffic Management Institute that oversees driving schools, said. Taliban has implemented new rules to restrict women's rights in Afghanistan since seizing power.

388.title: Maha police personnel's leaves cancelled amid Raj Thackeray's loudspeaker warning
388.article_body: Maharashtra DGP Rajneesh Seth on Tuesday, while appealing to citizens to maintain peace, informed that leaves of police personnel have been cancelled in view of the ongoing law and order situation in the state. MNS chief Raj Thackeray's speech calling for removal of loudspeakers from mosques is being looked into and legal action will be taken if needed, Seth added.

389.title: Russia claims it hit Ukraine logistics centre having US weapons
389.article_body: Russia has struck a military airfield near Ukraine's southwestern city of Odesa with missiles, the Russian Defence Ministry said on Tuesday. "Hangars containing unmanned Bayraktar TB2 drones as well as missiles and ammunition from the US and European countries were destroyed," it added. Russian missiles and artillery also hit several military targets across Ukraine, including command centres.

390.title: 1 arrested, 5 booked over child marriage in Rajasthan's Jhalawar
390.article_body: Rajasthan Police arrested one person and booked five others for allegedly arranging a child marriage in Rajasthan's Jhalawar last week. The matter came to light when a video clip of the minor couple entering into wedlock surfaced, police said. Accordingly, a case was registered against the accused under the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act, 2006.

391.title: Prisons shouldn't become centres for anti-national activities: MHA
391.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has written to all the states and Union Territories and their prison authorities to take effective steps to prevent prisons from becoming breeding grounds for anti-national activities. For this, the Ministry issued an order suggesting a regular inspection of prisons. Moreover, it also stressed on the need to strengthen security arrangements.

392.title: In our eyes we have found the best playing XI: KKR's Nitish Rana
392.article_body: Reacting to the criticism over the frequent changes in their playing XI, KKR batter Nitish Rana said if they keep winning, then any XI is the best. He added, "In our eyes, we've got the best XI, probably the outsiders feel that we haven't. The comfortable way in which we won [against RR]...means our playing XI is set," he added.

393.title: Wish my wife & kids had met you: Sanjay Dutt on Nargis' death anniversary
393.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt penned a note for his mother late actress Nargis on social media to mark her death anniversary. He wrote, "Not a single moment goes by when I don't remember you. Ma, you were the basis of my life and the strength of my soul. I wish my wife and kids would have met you."

394.title: Amazon to pay US staff travel expenses of up to $4,000 for abortions
394.article_body: Amazon will cover up to $4,000 per year in travel costs for US employees seeking non-life threatening medical treatments, including elective abortion and transgender care. As per the announcement, the benefits will apply to treatments that are not available inside a 100-mile radius of an employee's home. This comes amid rising restrictions for abortion procedures in the US.

395.title: Rajasthan CM instructs officials to head to Jodhpur following violence
395.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday convened high-level meeting with state's DGP, other officials on law and order situation following violence in Jodhpur. Gehlot directed officials, including Jodhpur in-charge Minister Dr Subhash Garg, to immediately head to city. Curfew has been imposed in 10 areas of Jodhpur as clashes broke out between two communities at Jalori Gate after Eid prayers.

396.title: Steps being taken in higher education to empower youth, says Amit Shah
396.article_body: Addressing the students of Nrupathunga University on Tuesday in Bengaluru, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi is building infrastructure for higher education such that India's youth can stand at par with global levels. "The future of any country is built by the youth and their character," he added.

397.title: DCW rescues 5 minor boys from bangle making unit in Delhi
397.article_body: Five minor boys employed as child labour at a bangle making unit in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area were rescued by Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) on Monday. According to DCW, the children hailed from Bihar and had come to the national capital over a month ago to earn livelihood. "The boys...were beaten up frequently and mercilessly by their employer," DCW said.

398.title: Domestic mutual funds subscribe 71% of LIC IPO anchor book
398.article_body: Domestic mutual funds invested ₹4,002.27 crore, accounting for 71.12% of the total ₹5,627 crore that LIC IPO mobilised from anchor investors on Monday. The largest investor was SBI Mutual Fund, which invested ₹1,006.89 crore. Overall, LIC issued 59.29 million equity shares to 123 anchor investors at the upper price band of the offer of ₹949 per share.

399.title: Many times Lata didi felt she's an orphan: Hridaynath Mangeshkar
399.article_body: Speaking about her sister, late singer Lata Mangeshkar, Hridaynath Mangeshkar said, "Lata Mangeshkar didn't become Lata Mangeshkar just like that. She had to go through a lot...There were...many times she used to feel that she's an orphan, she has no one," he added. "And the way she stood up after being...broken is what makes her a legend," he added.

400.title: If they've a good story, I'll be there: Olsen on potential Scarlet Witch movie
400.article_body: Elizabeth Olsen, on being asked if Scarlet Witch will ever get a solo movie, said, "I don't know, but if they have a good story to tell, I'll be there." She made her Marvel Cinematic Universe debut in 2014 in the post-credit scene of 'Captain America: The Winter Soldier'. Olsen played one of the leads in the web series 'WandaVision'.
